Basic Test 1.question: He placed the book on the **(table)**.
The **(quick)** brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.
The cat is sitting **(under)** the table.
We went for a walk **(after)** dinner.
The old man told a **(fascinating)** story.
We will meet **(near)** the clock tower.
The stars shone **(brightly)** in the night sky.
I saw a snake **(while)** I was walking.
Radhika was sitting **(between)** Sonali and Priya.

Basic Test 2.question: He ate **(three)** slices of pizza for lunch.
This is my **(first)** trip to London.
**(Her)** bag was stolen in the hall.
The dog barked at the **(strange)** man.
They are playing **(outside)** with their friends.
The **(band)** performed really well at the concert.

Basic Test 3.question: The children played **happily(a)/happy(b)/happiness(c)** in the park.
We were disturbed by the **loudly(a)/loud(b)/loudness(c)** music.
His **bravely(a)/brave(b)/bravery(c)** saved him from the danger.
His painting captured the **beauty(a)/beautifully(b)/beautiful(c)** of those mountains
He completed the task with good **efficiently(a)/efficient(b)/efficiency(c)**.
Radhika always behaves in a **polite(a)/politely(b)/politeness(c)** manner.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Considerable encouragement for the scheme / has been received from the Bengal Chamber of Commerce /which has promised their full support.
options: has been received from the Bengal Chamber of Commerce
which has promised their full support
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan which wala clause Bengal Chamber of Commerce ke liye aaya hai. Jo ki kisi sanstha ka naam hai aur Singular hai. Isliye yahan 'their' nahi 'its' ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: He is one of / those who would much rather / sacrifice his life than turn / disloyal to the country.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan ye who wala Adjectival Clause those ko refer karne ke liye likha gya hai jo ki Plural hai. Yaani cheeze plural ke hisaab se chalegi, isliye Possessive Adjective 'His' nahi 'their' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: The Taj Mahal / is one of / the most beautiful / creation in the world.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan "of" Preposition selection ko dikhane ke liye use ki gayi hai isliye iske baad aane wala Noun Plural me prayog kiya jayega isliye 'Creation' nahi 'Creations' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: It goes without saying / that your house which / is in Delhi is far better / than my one in various ways.
options: is in Delhi is far better
than my one in various ways
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Your house ka comparison 'my house' se hona hai jiske liye Possessive pronoun "mine" ka use hoga 'My one' jaisa English me koi shabd nahi hai.

Pronoun Test 1.question: I am not sure / if the red car / in the parking slot / is your.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Possessive Adjective kabhi akele use nahi hote yahan "your car" wala meaning dena tha isliye Possessive Pronoun "yours" ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Each cigarette which / a person smokes does / some harm and eventually you / may get a serious disease from its effects.
options: may get a serious disease from its effects.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Vakya ke meaning ke anusar serious bimari us vyakti ko hogi jo cigrette smoke karta hai na ki is vakya ko sunne wale ko 'you' pronoun listener ko represent karta hai, hame us vyakti ko refer karna hai jo cigrette smoke karta hai isliye yahan par 'you' nahi 'he' ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Any of the two / pictures which depict / the real pictures of the present / politicians is worth seeing.
options: the real pictures of the present
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Any का use हम तब करते हैं जब हमें दो से ज़्यादा में से कोई भी एक वाला meaning देना होता है और either का use हम तब करते हैं जब हमें दो में से कोई भी एक वाला meaning देना होता है। यहाँ दो चीजों की बात हो रही है इसलिए यहाँ ‘any’ का नहीं ‘either’ का use होगा।

Pronoun Test 1.question: You say / it's your problem / but I say it's / my also.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Possessive adjective akele use nahi kiye jaate, yahan 'my problem' wala meaning dena hai. Isliye yahan Possessive pronoun 'mine' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: I had to hold on to the wall / to steady itself / or I could have fallen.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan vakya ka meaning yeh hai ki mujhe deewar ko pakadna pada khud ko sthir karne ke liye. Toh 'I' ke anusar yahan Reflexive pronoun 'Itself' nahi balki 'myself' ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: You may be an editor or a reporter, / this makes you sit, / that makes you run.
options: You may be an editor or a reporter,
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yeh usi concept par based hai jo class me aapko Cricket and Chess wale error me padhaya gya tha. Yahan this apne nearest noun reporter ko refer kar rha hai. Aur that editor ko refer kar raha hai parantu usse Meaning galat ho rha hai isliye yahan par editor aur reporter ko Interchange karna padega.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Neither of the two medical students/ suspected in the 'missing girl' case/ have so far been arrested.
options: Neither of the two medical students
Pronoun Test 1.solution:
Neither ek distributive pronoun hota hai. Isliye verb yahan singular aati hai. Yahan par 'have' nahi 'has' ka use hoga.
Note: Suspected yahan koi verb ki tarah se karya nahin kar raha hai yeh Past Participle hai jo ki Adjective ki tarah karya kar rha hai.

Pronoun Test 1.question: With food granaries overflowing, the Government is looking to liquidate his grain stock to prevent damage.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan hume Government Subject ke anusar Possessive adjective lagana hai. Isliye yahan 'His' nahin 'Its' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: The people in my office are smarter than other offices.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Mere office ke People ka comparison dusre office ke people se hoga na ki office se isliye 'those in other offices' likhna padega.

Pronoun Test 1.question: My older brother, / which you’ll / meet later, / is a dentist.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan hume Brother, noun ko Refer karne ke liye ek Relative Pronoun likhna hai aur Human being ke liye who/whom ka prayog kiya jata hai which animals aur things ke liye use kiya jata hai yahan hume meet verb ka object banana hai isliye 'whom' ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: A current account is a deposit account/ which is offered by banks mainly/ to firms and companies who / need banking facilities very frequently.
options: A current account is a deposit account
which is offered by banks mainly
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan hume firms and companies ko refer karne ke liye ek Relative Pronoun likhna hai yeh dono non-living hai. Isliye yahan par 'who' nahi 'which' ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: We ordered a Pizza / which are one of / my favourite foods.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan 'which' Relative Pronoun pizza ke liye likha gya hai. Relative Pronoun ka apna khudka koi number Gender nahi hota yeh 'which' yahan Pizza ke liye aaya hai jo ki singular ki tarah use ho raha hai. Isliye 'which' ke baad Singular Verb ka prayog hoga 'are' nahin 'is' aayega.

Pronoun Test 1.question: This is the woman/ whom all sons are married/ and well/ settled in their life.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Is vakya ka arth yeh hai ki ye wo aurat hai jiske saare bete Married hain aur well settled hain, toh yahan hume woman ka sons par Possesion bananaa hai toh yahan ek esa shabd chahiye jo Possession ko dikhata ho isliye 'whose' ka use hoga 'whom' keval ek objective case hota hai. Yahan Objective Case ki requirement nahin hai, kyunki All sons Subject ho chuka hai, are linking verb hai aur 'married' aur 'well settled' adjective hai jo subject complement ki tarah se kaam kar rahe hain. Isliye yahan hume Objective Case ki avshyakta nahi hai. Balki ek esa shabd chahiye jo woman ka 'All sons' par Possession dikhaye isliye yahan 'whom' nahi 'whose' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Now it has finally dawned/ upon her that one/ should never compromise/ with his dignity, integrity and self respect.
options: with his dignity, integrity and self respect
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Is Clause ka subject 'one' hai. Isliye possession bhi 'one's' ke according hi banega. Isliye 'his' nahi 'one's' ka prayog hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: There are a number of new/ arrivals in this shoe store/ but only those shoes/ which are old one are available on discounted price.
options: There are a number of new
which are old one are available on discounted price
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan do galtiyan hai. One ka jagah Ones ka use hoga kyunki hume Shoes ko refer karne ke liye Plural Pronoun chahiye aur dusre which ki jagah that ka use hoga kyunki yeh Relative Pronooun shoes ko refer kar rha hai. Jisse pehle only those laga hua hai. Jo is par emphasis daal raha hai. Is liye yahan 'which' nahi 'that' relative Pronoun use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Your friend and you/ are here, but who/ of you is to work with me.
options: of you is to work with me
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan is clause ka arth yeh hai ki tum me se mere sath kaun kaam karega is Clause ke meaning se aur sath hi Of Preposition jo Selection ko dikhati hai usko lage hone se clear ho raha hai ki hume yahan Selection karwana hai. Aur Selection case me humesha 'Which' interrogative pronoun ka prayog hota hai.

Pronoun Test 1.question: The articles/ published in this magazine/ are better than/ that magazine.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Ek magazine ke Articles ka Comparison dusre magazine ke Articles se hi hoga isliye yahan those ka prayog hoga sath hi Published Adjective jo first clause me de rakha hai. Use bhi hume meaning ko same rakhne ke liye, repeat karna padega. Isliye 'those published in that magazine' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: After a long gap, / we went shopping / last Sunday and bought / that we wanted.
Pronoun Test 1.solution:
Yahan hume bought verb ka object banane ke liye noun clause ki requirement hai na ki koi Adjectival Clause ki isliye hum yahan par that nahi what relative pronoun ka use karenge jo noun clause banane ke liye use kiya jata hai.
Note:- we went shopping me koi galti nahi hai yahan 'went' ke baad 'for' preposition understood ho jaati hai yeh structure Allowed hai.

Pronoun Test 1.question: He was not aware of/ the things and the people/ who had surrounded him.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan hume esa Relative Pronoun chahiye jo cheezon aur insaano dono ko refer kar sakta ho isliye yahan 'that' relative Pronoun ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Her mother promised to / give her anything what she / wanted if she/ passed in the examination.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan anything pronoun ko define karne ke liye ek Adjectival Clause ki zarurat hai na ki Noun clause ki isliye yahan 'what' nahi 'that' relative pronoun ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Those who are late they will not be allowed inside the classroom.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan 'will not be allowed' wala jo part hai. Yeh verb those pronoun ke liye aayi hona chahiye thi, yadi hum they laga denge toh those pronoun ko verb nahi milegi isliye they pronoun yahan superfluous hai ise drop kar diya jayega.

Pronoun Test 1.question: He has never hurt my sentiments/ that is a mark of a great/ and altruistic lover.
options: He has never hurt my sentiments
that is a mark of a great
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan relative pronoun ka antecedent poora clause ban raha hai aur poore Clause ko refer karne ke liye 'which' Relative Pronoun ka use kiya jaata hai.

Pronoun Test 1.question: Whom do you / think she is, if she knows / so many things / about you?
options: think she is, if she knows
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan 'who' and 'whom' she is wale clause ke according bhara jaana hai, linking verb ke baad kabhi objective case nahi aate, humesha subjective case hi aate hain isliye 'whom' nahi 'who' ka prayog kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 1.question: You can buy that/ you want if/ you top this exam.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan buy verb ko object ki zarurat hai. Yaani noun clause ki zarurat hai. Isliye yahan 'that' ka nahi what/whatever ka use hoga what ka arth hoga jo tumhe chahiye aur whatever ka arth hoga jo bhi tumhe chahye. Dono hi use kiye jaa sakte hain.

Pronoun Test 1.question: He is the same man which I saw yesterday at the gate.
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan the same se, man par emphasis daala jaa raha hai. Isliye yahan relative pronooun 'which' nahi 'that' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 1.question: The five brothers / are at daggers-drawn,/ so they feel it below their dignity/ to talk to each other.
options: so they feel it below their dignity
Pronoun Test 1.solution: Yahan five brothers ke liye Reciprocal pronoun lagana hai isliye reciprocal pronoun 'one another' ka use hoga na ki 'each other' ka.

Pronoun Test 2.question: We thought / there was a good idea / to wear snow boots / before we stepped out.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: 'It' and 'there' dono hi introductory Subject ka kaam kar lete hain. But dono alag alag jagah use kiye jaate hain. Yahan hume 'to wear' infinitive ko refer karne ke liye Introductory Subject ki zarurat thi. Jo kaam 'it' karta hai 'there' nahi.

Pronoun Test 2.question: I find that / I get myself tired / very easily / these days.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan 'get' linking verb ki tarah se work kar raha 'I' subject banega 'get' linking verb hai aur 'tired' subject complement ki tarah se work kar raha hai. Yahan koi Action nahi ho rha hai na hi kisi object ki zarurat hai isliye yahan Reflexive pronoun 'myself' ka prayog nahi hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: There is many ways / to make / a stranger feel / welcome in the community.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Jab 'there' word introductory subject ki tarah work karta hai to verb real subject ke according aati hai. Yahan real subject 'ways' hai isliye verb plural aayegi 'is' nahi 'are' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Me and my friends / often go / to the cinema / together.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan do changes karne padenge, ek toh yeh General sentence hai isliye Pronoun ka sequence '231' use karna tha, aur dusra hume yahan subjective case ki zarurat hai isliye 'me' nahi 'I' aana tha isliye yahan par my friend and I ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Payal as well as her friends was / absented themselves / from the class because / it was the day of 'Bihar-band'.
options: Payal as well as her friends was
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
Absent do kaam karta hai verb banna ya adjective banna jab yeh verb banta hai toh apne sath Reflexive Pronoun rakhta hai but is sentence ka structure thoda complex hai yahan (a) part me was diya gya hai aur (b) part me absented likha gya hai agar hum ise passive maane toh bhi passive ke andar object nahi hota hai isliye themselves drop hoga leking yahan passive ka koi sense nahi hai isliye passive manna bhi sahi nahi hoga toh sabse best options yahan pr yeh kiya ja sakta hai ki absented ko kaat kar absent likh de jisse veh adjective ban jayega aur adjective ke sath reflexive pronoun nahi aata hai toh themselves ko drop kar diya jayega. Yaani sahi sentence hoga Payal as well as her friends was absent from the class.
Note:- as well as yahan koi simile nahi hai yeh ek Prepositional phrase hai isliye verb Payal ke according aayegi jo ki was likhi gayi hai jo ki sahi hai.

Pronoun Test 2.question: The principal objected / to them wearing short skirts / at the function.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: 'object to' yeh ek Phrasal verb ki tarah se work karta hai aur sentence ke meaning ke according principal ka jo objection hai veh wearing se hai, na ki them se isliye object to phrasal verb ka object wearing banega jo ki ek noun Gerund ke roop me work karega isliye yahan isse pehle 'them' pronoun ka nahi 'their' possessive adjective ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Rashmi and me are / planning to go on / a road trip to Manali / next summer.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan hume Verb ke subject ki zarurat hai isliye 'me' nahi 'i' ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Neither he / nor his brother / can walk faster / than me.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Subject ka comparison Subject se hota hai. Isliye yahan than ke baad objective case 'me' nahi 'I' ka use hoga, jiske baad 'can' modal understood hai, use likhna chahe toh likh bhi sakte hain 'than me' nahi 'than I' (Can) ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: It will / be us who will / buy a new house / No error.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan 'it' introductory subject hai. Hume real subject 'we' par stress daalna tha isliye yahan Subjective case 'we' ka use hoga na ki objective case 'us' ka.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Who was / there but she to look / after the family in distress?
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan 'but' ka matlab 'ke sivay ya ke alawa' hai. Yaani but yahan par preposition ki tarah work kar rha hai. Isliye uske baad Objective case ka use hoga. 'she' nahi 'her' ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: He prostrated before / his master / who had returned from / London after a year.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Prostrate verb ek transitive verb hoti hai jise object chahiye aur yahan meaning dena hai, usne khud ko jhukaya, isliye Prostrate Verb ke object ke roop me 'himself' reflexive pronoun ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: He, you and I are to be blamed / for all the mess in / the last evening's program.
options: He, you and I are to be blamed
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan blamed verb se pta chal raha hai ki koi galat kaam ko represent karna isliye yahan Pronoun ka sequence 123 chalega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: We must do / regular exercises / to keep / ourselves fit.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Jab action khud par hi hota hai toh 'keep' linking verb ki tarah se work karti hai is sentence ka matlab hai ki, hume Regular exercise karni chahiye fit rehne ke liye isliye yahan par Reflexive pronoun ka use nahi hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: In the ideal 21st century classroom, children are actually excited about going to school, and there is little or no discipline problems because everyone is eager to learn.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan 'there' introductory subject hai aur 'discipline problems' real subject hai, 'there' ke Case me real subject ke according verb aati hai. Isliye plural verb ka use kiya jayega isliye 'is' nahi 'are' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: The manager said, “Could you please / confirm me whether you / have received all the items / that you had ordered?”
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Confirm verb on object Generally koi cheez hoti hai, kisi cheez ko confirm kiya jaata hai na ki kisi person ko isliye yahan confirm verb ka object aage likha whether wala clause banega, but agar hume Human being ko bhi object banana ho toh confirm verb ke baad 'to' preposition laga kar Human being ko is preposition ka object bana kar likh sakte hain. Toh ya toh hum sentence me se 'Me' ko hata sakte hain ya 'Me' se pehle 'to' laga kar sentence ko theek kar sakte hain.

Pronoun Test 2.question: I asked my friend / where had he / learnt to dance / so well.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan speaker kisi ko kuchh puchh nahi raha balki kisi ko kuchh bata rha hai. Yeh Indirect Speech me likha gya sentence hai. Isliye yahan Interrogative Structure ka use nahi hoga. 'where had he'  nahi 'where he had' ka use hoga taaki sentence Assertive ban sake.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Lalitha will go / to sister’s house / in Mumbai / this summer.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Sentence ke meaning ke according 'sister’s' se pehle 'her' possessive adjective ka use karna padega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: The man standing / beside the minister is  / a friend of me.
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
A freind of mine: Is structure ka meaning hota hai ki mere doston me se koi ek. Yahan 'of' preposition selection ka work karta hai.
The friend of me: Is structure ka meaning hota hai mera koi ek particular dost. Yahan 'of' prepostion possession ka work karta hai.

Pronoun Test 2.question: No one of them came to the inauguration of our new Factory.
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
'No one' aur 'none' me kuchh difference hota hai jaise ki,
(a) 'none' insaano aur cheezo dono ke liye aa sakta hai. 'no one' generally sirf insaano ke liye use kiya jaata hai.
(b) 'none' ko kisi 'Group me se koi nahi' kehne liye  use kar sakte hai, but 'no one' 'group me se koi nahi'  wala meaning dene ke liye use hota hai. Yahan group me se koi nahi wala meaning dena hai, isliye 'no one' nahi 'none' ka use hoga.

Pronoun Test 2.question: I don’t recognise none of the politicians who have been invited to be the speakers today.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan recognize se pehle jo 'not' hai uski wajah se yeh clause pehle hi negative ho chuka hai. None lagane se Double Negative ho jayega isliye yahan par 'none' nahi 'any' ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: In order for he to attend the meeting, he needs to prepare exhaustive notes.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: use 'him' instead of 'he' kyunki for ek preposition hai aur preposition ke baad iska object aata hai isliye 'he' ke objective case 'him' ka use kiya jayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: What should we do / is a matter of / our own choice / and desire.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yeh koi question nahi hai isliye interrogative structure ka nahi assertive structure ka use hoga Subject ke baad verb aayegi isliye yahan 'what we should do' ka use hoga na ki 'what should we do' ka.

Pronoun Test 2.question: On Saturday Rahul visited his professor to whom he had an appointment.
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
Is sentence me pronoun ki nahi balki prepostion ki galti hai. Appointment kisi ke sath fix hota hai isliye yahan par 'to whom' nahi 'with whom' likhna chahiye tha.
For example:- He had an appointment with his doctor.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Mr. Sunil Pawar, our representative / he will / attend the meeting / on our behalf.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan Mr. Sunil Pawar subject ki tarah se work kar raha hai, our representative case in apposition hai jo subject ko define kar rha hai aage aane wali verb subject 'Sunil Pawar' ko milni chahiye thi. Isliye yahan likha gya 'he' pronoun superfluous hai use hata den.

Pronoun Test 2.question: They who are in this room / should not move from the place / where they are standing, said the / leader of the criminals.
options: They who are in this room
should not move from the place
where they are standing, said the
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
Relative Pronoun se pehle 'they' ka demonstrative Version likha jaata hai isliye yahan 'they' nahi 'those' ka use kiya jayega, yeh baat aapko yaad hi karni hai. Bas dhyan rakhiye Introductory Subject 'It' wale jo sentence hote hain.
For example :- It is they who took you to hospital.
Yahan par 'They' hi rahega isme 'Those' nahi karna hai.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Cows are amongst the gentlest of animals; none shows more passionate tenderness towards their young.
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Waise toh 'none' ke sath singular aur plural verb dono hi allowed hoti hai balki singular verb ko prefer kiya jaata hai but yahan sentence me aage 'their' possessive adjective ka use kiya jaata hai jisse pta chal raha hai ki plural wala sense dena hai aur yeh Question ek famous Author ki novel ki line se uthaya gya hai toh jaisa author ne likha tha SSC ne aisa hi utha liya hai isliye yahan par 'their' ko dekhte hue hum plural verb ka use karenge.

Pronoun Test 2.question: The woman is waiting to see you looks rather angry.
options: The women whose waiting to see you looks rather angry
The women who is waiting see you looks rather angry
The woman who is waiting to see you looks rather angry
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan do verb di gayi hai. Jisse pata chal raha hai ki do clauses banne chahiye aur sentence ka meaning bhi kuchh esa hai. Jo aurat bahar tumhe milne ka wait kar rhi hai, gusse me dikhayi pad rahi hai. Isliye yahan par 'who' relative pronoun ka use hoga aur wait ke baad direct verb nahi likh sakte isliye infinitive 'to see' ka use hoga, isliye (c) option best hai.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Thomas is a man of word who have been paying back the borrowed money in instalments.
options: Thomas is a man of word
Pronoun Test 2.solution: Yahan 'who' relative pronoun hai, Thomas ko hum keh sakte hain 'a man of word' jiska meaning hota hai apni baat ka pakka hona. 'Thomas' singular hai isliye 'who' ke baad singualr verb ka use kiya jaayega, 'have' nahi 'has' aayega.

Pronoun Test 2.question: Civil servants / should exert to help / a common man.
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
use 'themselves' after 'exert'
'exert' verb transitive hai isliye reflexive pronoun ka use karenge jo exert verb ka object banega.
exert - to make big mental or physical efforts.

Pronoun Test 2.question: She is the woman / who I know, / you can trust blindly.
Pronoun Test 2.solution:
replace 'who' with 'whom'.
Yahan relative pronoun 'trust' verb ke liye lagana hai. Jise object chahiye. Isliye whom ka use hoga.
Note :- Relative pronoun who/whom ka yahan 'know' verb se koi relation nahi hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: The wedding gown / looked decently / despite being / studded with jewels.
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(c) Use 'decent' instead of 'decently' kyunki looked yahan linking verb hai aur linking verb ke baad adjective ka use hota hai 'decently' adverb aur 'decent' adjective hai.

Note:- look verb ka matlab jab 'dekhna' hota hai tab yeh verb action verb hoti hai. Jab look verb ka matlab 'dikhayi padna' hota hai tab yeh linking verb hoti hai.

Eg:- (a) She is looking at me (action verb)
       (b) She looks sad (linking verb)

Adjective Test 1.question: The less you are confused while taking / these tests, the less errors / you will make.
options: The less you are confused while taking
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use fewer errors in place of less errors. kyunki 'errors' noun countable hai aur countable ke sath little nahi few adjective ki degree ka use hota hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: The recently hike / in the price of petroleum products / will hit / household budgets severely.
options: in the price of petroleum products
Adjective Test 1.solution: (b) use ‘recent’ instead of ‘recently’ yahan 'hike' noun hai aur noun ke pehle adjective ka use kiya jaata hai 'recently' adverb aur 'recent' adjective hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: None can / believe that / Ramesh is happier / than grieved to know it.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use more happy in place of happier.  kyunki jab ek hi person ki do qualities ka apas me comparison hota hai, toh comparative degree 'er' wale structure se nahi 'more' wale structure se banayi jaati hi.

Adjective Test 1.question: If he wants / farther information, / send him / to me.
Adjective Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘further’ instead of ‘farther’ kyunki farther ka use distance ko refer karne ke liye kiya jaata hai jabki 'further' ka use more/addition ko refer karne ke liye kiya jaata hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: Your comment / on this issue / is more right / and I am with you all along the way.
options: and I am with you all along the way
Adjective Test 1.solution: Remove ‘more’ before ‘right’.  kyunki 'right' adjective apne aap me absolute hai isko qualify karne ke liye koi adverb nahi lagega.

Adjective Test 1.question: The team won / very easily / at the recent sports event.
Adjective Test 1.solution:
No error

Note:- Sports event me koi galti nahi hai khelo ko represent karne ke liye 'sports' word ka hi use hoga 'sport' word ka nahi.

Adjective Test 1.question: Sachin Tendulkar is the humblest / and prolific / cricket player in the history of cricket.
options: cricket player in the history of cricket.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use most prolific in place of prolific. Kyunki jab do adjective 'and' conjuction se jode jaate hain toh dono same degree me likhe jaate hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: It was really surprising / that the two bosom friends fought / over such a triviale matter / and stopped all communications with each other.
options: and stopped all communications with each other
that the two bosom friends fought
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(a) use ‘trivial’ instead of ‘triviale’ because the correct word is trivial which means having little value or importance:

Note:- Is type ke spelling based error waise toh kam aate hain lekin kabhi kabhi aa jaate hain.

Adjective Test 1.question: Ramesh is smarter / enough to get / selected for this / post, without any recommendations.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use smart in place of smarter. Kyunki yahan Ramesh ka kisi aur se comparison nahi karna hai isliye comparative degree use nahi hogi. Yahan meaning dena hai Ramesh enough smart hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: The management is not perturbed about appointing / someone who is knowledgeable but is more inclined / towards filling the position with a person / who will be obsequous and will dance to their tunes.
options: someone who is knowledgeable but is more inclined
towards filling the position with a person
The management is not perturbed about appointing
who will be obsequous and will dance to their tunes
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(d) use ‘obsequious’ instead of ‘obsequous’ because the correct word is obsequious which means too eager to praise or obey someone aur (d) part me 'their' ki jagah par 'Its' bhi hoga. Kyunki yeh managment ke liye aaya hai.

Note:- Is type ke spelling based questions rarely hi exam me aate hain lekin kabhi kabhi aa jaate hain.

Adjective Test 1.question: Of the three, women wine and songs, / the former / brought about his ruin.
options: Of the three, women wine and songs,
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use first in place of former. Kyunki yahan teen me se sabse pehle waale ki baat karni hai isliye 'first' ka use hoga 'former' word ka use hum tab karte hain jab do me se pehle ko kehna hota hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: The Dussehra celebrations / in Mysore / this year / are grandest than / in any other part / of the state.
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(c) Grandest than ki jagah par grander than those ka use hoga kyunki 'than' conjunction se pata chal raha hai ki yahan comparative degree lagani hai.

Note:- Yahan Mysore me ho rahe dussehra celebration ka comparison baaki poore state me ho rahe dussehra celebration se karna hai but yahan superlative degree ka use nahi hoga kyunki than bhi laga hai aur other bhi laga hai warna fir do part me error karna pad jaata hai aur jaisa ki aapko class me padhaya gaya hai comparative degree laga kar bhi kisi ek ka comparision ek se zyada cheezon ke sath kiya jaa sakta hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: No less than thousands of spectators are / waiting for Dhoni to come out / in the field and play his / masterful stroke.
options: No less than thousands of spectators are
waiting for Dhoni to come out
in the field and play his
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use fewer in place of less. Kyunki 'no less than' is phrase ka use uncountable cheezon ke liye hota hai aur 'no fewer than' is phrase ka use countable cheezon ke liye hota hai. Aage likha thousands of spectators se pata chal rha hai ki veh countable hai plural hai isliye 'no fewer than' ka use hoga.

Adjective Test 1.question: The weather / is much / more warmer / than it was a few days before.
options: than it was a few days before.
Adjective Test 1.solution: (a) Warmer se pehle likha gaya 'more' hatana padega kyunki warmer already comparative degree hai iske sath more laga kar ise aur comparative banane ki zarurat nahi hi. Agar 'intensity' hi badhane ki baat hai toh uske liye 'much' already laga hua hai. Isliye yahan 'more' ko drop kar diya jayega.

Adjective Test 1.question: While you are in Agra, / you must not miss / seeing the TajMahal, / because it is a worth seeing monument.
options: because it is a worth seeing monument
Adjective Test 1.solution:
Use monument worth seeing in place of worth seeing monument. Kyunki ‘worth + V1 + ing’ se jab adjective banate hain to ing wala structure humesha worth ke baad hi lagana hota hai yeh structure aapko yaad hi karna hi.

Eg:- It is a movie worth watching.
        It is a place worth visiting.

Adjective Test 1.question: After entering the town, / go straight and then / take a sharpest turn / towards your left / to reach the mall.
Adjective Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘sharp’ instead of ‘sharpest’ kyunki sharpest superlative degree hoti hai aur yahan positive degree ki zarurat hai kyunki yahan 'turn' ka kisi aur turn se comparison nahi karna hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: Little support from / your parents would have / placed you on the top / of the world for sure.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Kyunki 'a little' ka matlab hota hai 'Thoda' aur 'little' ka matlab hota hai 'na ke barabar' aur yahan sentence ka meaning positive hai. Yahan meaning yeh hai ki parents se mili hui thodi si bhi support tumhe pakka duniya ke top tak pahuncha deti hai. Yahan 'na ke barabar' support wala meaning nahi dena hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: Economists have declared that 2020 graduates / will face the worse job depression / since the Great Depression / because of the COVID-19 pandemic.
options: will face the worse job depression
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(b) use ‘worst’ instead of ‘worse’ kyunki worse comparative degree hoti hai aur yahan superlative degree ki need hai kyunki yahan 2020 ke depression ka comparison 'great depression' se lekar ab tak duniya me aaye saare depression se karna hai.

Note:- depression ka matlab hota hai bahut bada recession

Adjective Test 1.question: It is well known / that Mrs. Indira Gandhi / was the first politician / of her time.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use ‘foremost’ in place of ‘first’ kyunki first ka matlab hota hai 'sabse pehla' aur foremost ka matlab hota hai 'us time me sabse mashoor' toh yahan sentence ke meaning ke according 'foremost' ka use hoga.

Adjective Test 1.question: Parul is / ten years / elder than / her sibling.
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(a) Zyadatar books me is question ka answer aapko elder ke baad 'to' lagana milega aur yeh concept S.P. Bakshi me galat likha tha jiski wajah se har book ke andar yahi answer aapko diya gya hai aapko bhi 'elder' ke baad 'to' hi manna padega but agar sahi grammar ki baat karen toh elder word ese linking verb ke baad laga kar Comparison ke liye use nahi hota Elder word sirf noun ke pehle likha jaa sakta hai.

Eg- She is my elder sister.

Agar 'pure grammar' ki baat karen toh yahan par sahi answer hona chahiye tha older than leking ab saari books me bhi galat likha hai toh obviously competitive exams galat ko hi sahi manenge. Isliye exams etc. me aap bhi 'elder to' hi karke aayiyega.

Adjective Test 1.question: Bharatpur is transforming into / India's Most fastest growing bird sanctuary / attracting thousands of rare migratory birds / from Europe and Siberia.
options: India's Most fastest growing bird sanctuary
attracting thousands of rare migratory birds
Adjective Test 1.solution: Kyunki 'fastest' apne aap me superlative degree hai aur uske sath 'most' laga kar use aur superlative banane ki zarurat nahi hai, fir bhi agar intensity badhani hi ho toh 'by far the fastest' ya 'much the fastest' ka use kar sakte hain.

Adjective Test 1.question: Do you earn / so much to / make both / ends meet?
Adjective Test 1.solution:
(b) use ‘enough instead of ‘so much’ kyunki yahan hum kehna chahte hain ki 'kya aap paryapt paisa kamate hai?' Isliye enough ka use hoga aur 'so' ke sath generally 'that' ka pair banta hai isliye bhi yahan 'so' nahi aa payega.

Eg. He is so rich that he can by any car.

Adjective Test 1.question: This book is / as good, if / not better than that book.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use ‘as good as’ in place of ‘as good’. kyunki 'as good as' yahan par ek simile hai jise poora hi likha jayega. Is sentence ka asli structure yeh hai 'This book is as good as that book is if it is not better than that book is' yahan iska meaning yeh hai ki 'yeh kitaab utni hi achchi hai jitni veh kitaab hai agar usse zyada achchi nahi hai' toh inhi dono books ka do baar comparison hai isliye ‘subject + verb’ understood ho rhe hain but simile ek conjuction ka kaam karti hai veh poori hi likhi jayegi.

Adjective Test 1.question: He was not able / to give / many time / to his research.
Adjective Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘much’ instead of ‘many’ kyunki time ek uncountable noun hai iske sath 'many' ka use nahi kiya jaa sakta isliye 'much' ka use hoga.

Adjective Test 1.question: Hari lost / a hundred rupees note / yesterday.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Use ‘rupee’ in place of ‘rupees’ kyunki yahan 'hundred rupees' ye phrase 'note' noun ke liye adjective ki tarah se kaam kar rha hai isliye iska plural nahi kiya jaayega.

Adjective Test 1.question: An eight years old / girl has / made this / beautiful painting.
Adjective Test 1.solution: (b)'Eight year old girl' yahan par 'girl' noun ke liye adjective ki tarah se work kar rha hai isliye uska plural nahi kiya jayega isliye 'eight years old' nahi 'eight year old' hoga.

Adjective Test 1.question: Death is / more preferable / to / dishonor.
Adjective Test 1.solution: Remove ‘more’ kyunki preferable apne aap me hi comparison ko dikhata hai uske sath 'more' laga kar use comparative karne ki need nahi hai.

Adjective Test 1.question: All these boys / have come to college / without few knowledge / of English.
Adjective Test 1.solution: (a) Use ‘any’ instead of ‘few’ kyunki knowledge noun uncountable hota hai aur 'few' countable ke liye lagta hai isliye few toh aa nahi sakta dusri baat yahan par 'little' bhi nahi aa sakta kyunki 'without' laga hone ki wajah se sentence ka meaning already negative ho chuka hai. Yahan par ek neutral word lagana padega jo na positive ho na hi negative ho isliye meaning ke according yahan 'any' word ka use kiya jayega.

Adjective Test 1.question: The militants / entered the palace / from the utmost gate / with guns hidden in their clothes.
options: with guns hidden in their clothes.
Adjective Test 1.solution:
Use outermost in place of utmost. 'Outermost' ka matlab hota hai 'sabse bahar wala' aur 'utmost' ka matlab hota hai 'greatest'

Eg. This is a matter of utmost importance.

Adjective Test 2.question: The wedding reception will be hosted in Mumbai at a late date.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
(c) use ‘later’ instead of ‘late’
Late - (happening or being) near the end of a period of time:
Later - at a time in the future or after the time you have mentioned:

Adjective Test 2.question: Gold is / the most / precious of / all other metals.
Adjective Test 2.solution: Remove other. kyunki 'superlative degree ke case me exclude krne ki need nahi hoti.

Adjective Test 2.question: According to a recent study, drinking green tea thrice a week is associated with a longest and healthy life.
options: drinking green tea thrice a week
Adjective Test 2.solution:
‘Longest’ ki jagah par 'long' ka use kren kyunki jab 'and' conjuntion se do adjectives judte hain toh dono same degree me hone chahiye.
Note:- Agar hum yahan 'longer and healthier' likhte toh aur better meaning aata kyunki hume yahan 'green tea na peene walon' ka comparison 'green tea peene walon' se karna hai, isliye 'longer and hearthier' dono comparative degree me likhna better hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: Of the three cities, Mumbai, Delhi and Kolkata, / the latter is the / dirtiest.
options: Of the three cities, Mumbai, Delhi and Kolkata,
Adjective Test 2.solution: Use last in place of latter. kyunki do se zyaada options me se last wale ko refer karne ke liye 'last' word ka use hota hai, do me se baad wale ko refer krne ke liye 'latter' ka use hota hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: You must make a choice immediately because there is few time left.
Adjective Test 2.solution: (c) use ‘little’ instead of ‘few’ kyunki 'few' ka use countable noun ke sath kiya jaata hai aur 'time' ek uncountable noun hai isliye 'little/less' ka use hoga.

Adjective Test 2.question: On entering the crowding room / I could not see one person / whom I knew.
options: I could not see one person
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use crowded in place of crowding
yeh concept present participle vs past participle ke use par based hain.
Eg. Horrifying man = Darawna aadmi
Horrified man = dara hua aadmi
Present participle jab kisi noun ke liye lagaya jaata hai toh veh noun present participle me ho rhe kaam ka 'doer' hota hai aur past participle jab kisi noun ke liye lagaya jaata hai toh veh noun past participle me ho rhe kaam ka receiver hota hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: The invited guests preferred orange juice than hot coffee or chilled grapes.
Adjective Test 2.solution: (d) use ‘preferred orange juice to’ instead of ‘preferred orange juice’ kyunki senior, junior, prefer, preferred, prior, posterior, etc. ke sath to ka use kiya jaata hai than ka nahi.

Adjective Test 2.question: The vacancy was filled / by a young scholar / who had an extensible knowledge of ancient art.
options: who had an extensible knowledge of ancient art.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use 'extensive' in place of 'extensible'.
extensible :-able to be extended or stretched; extendable
extensive :- vast, large in quantity or number.

Adjective Test 2.question: The shopkeeper said / that he would accept / no less than three hundred rupees for the watch.
options: no less than three hundred rupees for the watch.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
No error
time, value, weight and length ko dikhane waale words jab ek unit ki tarah kaam karte hai toh unhe uncountable ki tarah treat kiya jaata hai.
Eg. 10 kilometers is a long distance to travel on foot.
10000 rupees is a very big amount for me.

Adjective Test 2.question: She is so vivacious / and expressive that she is a dear girl / to all of us.
options: and expressive that she is a dear girl
Adjective Test 2.solution: Place dear after girl. 'To all of us' veh phrase 'dear' adjective ko qualify karne ke liye aaya hai isliye sentence me 'ambiguity' ko hatane ke liye 'dear' adjective ko iske pehle likh diya jaata hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: The both children go to the same school.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
(b) use ‘both the’ instead of ‘the both’ kyunki 'all' aur 'both' ye do ese adjective hote hain jinke baad article ya koi aur possessive adjective etc. ka use kiya jaata hai.
Eg. All the boys
Both the boys
All my friends
Both my friends
Note:- yeh baat aapko yaad hi karni hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: Unless it is accepted to both the parties, an / arbitrator would be of no / use to settle this dispute.
options: Unless it is accepted to both the parties, an
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use acceptable in place of accepted.
accepted - Jise 'accept' kar liya gaya ho.
acceptable - Jise 'accept' kiya jaa sake.
Agar 'it is accepted' ka use karenge toh veh passive structure ho jayega aur aage 'by+doer' jaise kuchh nahi likha isliye meaning ke according aur structure ke according 'it is accepted' galat ho jayega. 'it is acceptable' se meaning and grammar dono theek rahenge.

Adjective Test 2.question: He likes to put all the garbage into a black small bag.
Adjective Test 2.solution: (d) use ‘small black bag’ instead of ‘black small bag’ kyunki kisi noun ke pehle use kiya jaane waale qualitative adjectives ka order opinion-Size-Age-Shape-Colour-Origin-Material hota hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: She has lost / the watch very / gifted by / her boyfriend.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use the very watch in place of the watch very.
'very' yahan emphatic adjective ki tarah se kaam kar rha hai watch ke liye iski position 'watch' noun se pehle hogi.

Adjective Test 2.question: I had a hard time paying the driver as I had only hundreds rupee note.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
only hundred rupees note ki jagah inme se koi ek use kren:
- only one hundred rupee note. (Sirf ek 100 rupees ka note)
- only one hundred rupees (Sirf 100 rupees)
- only hundred rupee notes (Sirf 100-100 rupees wale note)

Adjective Test 2.question: When I was walking / along the bank of the river, / I saw an asleep man / in rags and tatters.
options: along the bank of the river,
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use I saw a man who was asleep in place of I saw an asleep man.
kyunki 'asleep' ek esa adjective hai jo ki noun se pehle nahi lagaya jaata balki iska use 'predicatively' yaani linking verb ke baad likh kar kiya jaata hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: Don’t worry, there is less time for the train to arrive.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
yahan koi comparison nahi ho rha isliye 'less' ka use nahi hoga. inme se koi bhi word laga sakte hain:
some time (thoda time)
enough time (Paryapt time)
a little time (thoda time)
Note:- yahan 'few' ki jagah 'little' ka use nahi ho sakta kyunki sentence ke shuru me 'don't worry' likha hai jisse pta chal raha hai ki hum aage positive meaning dena chahte hain. 'little' laga dene se meaning ho jayega ki 'na ke barabar time bacha hai'.

Adjective Test 2.question: The food tasted deliciously / and all present in the party / enjoyed it to their full.
options: and all present in the party
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use delicious in place of deliciously
kyunki 'taste' ek linking verb ki tarah se kaam kar rhi hai isliye uske baad koi adverb nahi balki adjective ka use kiya jaayega.

Adjective Test 2.question: He lost all his hardly earned money.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
use ‘hard’ instead of ‘hardly’
Hardly (adv)(na ke barabar) – only just; almost not:
Hard (adv)(mehenat se/zor se) – needing or using a lot of physical or mental

Adjective Test 2.question: He lost all his hardly earned money.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
use ‘hard’ instead of ‘hardly’
Hardly (adv)(na ke barabar) – only just; almost not:
Hard (adv)(mehenat se/zor se) – needing or using a lot of physical or mental

Adjective Test 2.question: She ran so fastly that I could not overtake her.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
(b) use ‘fast’ instead of ‘fastly’ kyunki 'fastly' koi word nahi hota,
correct word 'fast' hota hai chahe hume adjective banana ho ya adverb banana ho word 'fast' hi use kiya jaata hai.

Adjective Test 2.question: Even today / it is incredulous to think / that men have walked on the moon.
options: that men have walked on the moon.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
Use incredible in place of incredulous.
incredible (positive sense) (kuchh itna achcha ya bada ho ki yakeen na ho ki ye sahi me hai): impossible or very difficult to believe
incredulous (negative sense) (jo kisi cheez par shak kare): not willing or not able to believe something

Adjective Test 2.question: Platinum is costlier than any metal found on earth.
Adjective Test 2.solution: ‘Any metal’ ki jagah 'any other metal' ka use karen. kyunki jab ek noun ka comparison ek ese group se karna hota hai jiska wo khud ek part hota hai toh use exclude karna padta hai isliye yahan 'other' lagakar exclude karna padega.

Adjective Test 2.question: A skilful advertiser may be able to create / practically a monopoly for himself / not because his product is superior to / but because he has succeeded in inducing people to believe that it is.
options: A skilful advertiser may be able to create
not because his product is superior to
but because he has succeeded in inducing people to believe that it is.
Adjective Test 2.solution: Remove to after superior. kyunki yahan 'to' preposition ke baad koi noun hi available nahi hai isliye yahan superior ke baad to ka use nahi hoga.

Adjective Test 2.question: Deepak said he would pack few things he had and vacate the hostel room the next day.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
(c) use ‘the few’ instead of ‘few’ kyunki yahan meaning yeh hai ki wo apna thoda jitna equal hai wo pack karega aur hostel khali kar dega.
Note:- he had se pehle "that" understood hai yahan 'the few things that he had = the few things he had'

Adjective Test 2.question: Although the toys are altogether in the cupboard they are not properly arranged.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
(b) use ‘all together’ instead of ‘altogether’
Altogether – ‘completely’ or ‘in total’
All together – ‘with each other’, and is similar to together

Adjective Test 2.question: Scientists have found that life was creeping and crawling about the Earth 1.5 billion years early than previously thought.
Adjective Test 2.solution: (b) use ‘earlier’ instead of ‘early’ kyunki 'early' positive degree hoti hai aur yahan 'than' se pta chal rha ki comparative degree ki zarurat hai, isliye earlier ka use hoga.

Adjective Test 2.question: You should know / that the blind / leads a very difficult life.
Adjective Test 2.solution: replace leads with lead. 'the blind' ka matlab hai 'all blind people' – 'the + adjective' yahan ek common plural noun bana hua hai, isliye yahan plural verb ka use kiya jayega.

Adjective Test 2.question: I will give you / my notes if you promise / to return the same by Sunday.
options: to return the same by Sunday
Adjective Test 2.solution: replace 'the same' with 'them'. 'the same' ka use adjective ke roop me kiya jaata hai par hume yahan pronoun ki zarurat hai jo 'notes' noun ko refer karega and 'to return' infinitive ka object banega.

Adjective Test 2.question: The photograph which / was taken by Rahul is / comparatively better than this one.
Adjective Test 2.solution:
For exams replace 'better’ with 'good’
Note:-(c) According to correct grammar comparatively should be removed. but sab books me iska answer galat diya hai toh aapko bhi paper me 'good' hi karke aana padega.

Verb Test 1.question: The newspaper reported / that it was a mystery / how the thieves enter / into the house.
Verb Test 1.solution:
replace enter with broke
kyuki main clause past me hai to subclause bhi past me hoga.
break into (phrasal verb) - kisi ghar ya building etc me bina permission ghus jane
generally chori karne ke irade se
NOTE:-  Yahan 'enter' ki jagah 'entered' nahi kar sakte kyunki aage wale part me into diya hua hai, enter ke sath 'into' nahi aata kyunki 'enter' transitive verb hoti hai and ise object chahiye.

Verb Test 1.question: What should have been/ a great disaster /  was averted.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘could’ in place of ‘should’.
Meaning based error hai ye.
What should have been a great disaster = Jo bahut bada Distaster hona chahiye tha.
What could have been a great disaster = Jo bahut bada distaster ho sakta tha.

Verb Test 1.question: The arm was so badly injured / that he must have / it amputated
options: The arm was so badly injured
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘had to have’ in place of ‘must have’.
Main clause past me hai isliye 'must' ki past form 'had to' use hogi.
Iske aage ka structure causative verb par based hai jo advance verb chapter me padhaya jayega.

Verb Test 1.question: You must / be hurry, / otherwise you will / miss the train.
Verb Test 1.solution: Remove 'be' kyunki 'must' modal ke baad ek hi main verb aayegi 'be' and 'hurry' dono verbs hain. Sentence ke meaning ke according yahan 'hurry' main verb rahenge.

Verb Test 1.question: There was such a crowd/ that he would / not find his brother.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘could’ in place of ‘would’.
Meaning based error hai ye.
he would not find his brother = wo apne bhai ko nahi dhundega.
he could not find his brother = wo apne bhai ko nahi dhund paaya tha.

Verb Test 1.question: Distrust seems to / be a factor borne out /of prevailing circumstances.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘born’ in place of ‘borne’
Both born and borne are forms of verb 'bear'. Born is commonly used with the meaning "to give birth." Borne is used in adjective form with the meaning being carried by. eg water borne (paani ke dwara carry kiya jaane wala) air borne (hawa ke dwara carry kiya jaane wala) etc.
She was born in a log cabin in March of 1817.
This illnesses is caused by water-borne bacteria

Verb Test 1.question: The scooter that / I am using / these days is belonging / to my brother.
Verb Test 1.solution:
use ‘belongs’ instead of ‘is belonging’ Kyunki belong ek stative verb hai, Stative verb esi verbs hoti hain jinhe hum 'ing' form me use nahi karte.
Like -feel, believe, smell, hear, listen, look, belong, have, etc.

Verb Test 1.question: Would you find me / absent please do not/ forget to leave a message behind.
options: forget to leave a message behind.
Verb Test 1.solution: Use 'should' in place of 'would'. Yeh 'should' word ka ek unique use hai. Generally toh yeh modal hi hota hai par 'should' word conjunction bhi ban sakta hai aur tab iska matlab hota hai 'agar'. Yahan sentence ke meaning ke according 'agar' meaning dena hai isliye 'if' ya 'should' ka use hoga.

Verb Test 1.question: The new taxation rates / announced by the government / are bound to effect the export sector.
options: are bound to effect the export sector.
Verb Test 1.solution: Use ‘affect’ in place of ‘effect’. 'affect' generally ek verb ka work karta hai aur 'effect' noun ka. Infinitive 'to+v1' se banta hai, isliye yahan 'to affect' aayega.

Verb Test 1.question: A book market / was been operated by some  readers / in the street when / they reached there.
options: was been operated by some readers
Verb Test 1.solution: use ‘being’ instead of ‘been’ kyunki past continuous tense ka active voice me structure 'was/were + ing' hota hai aur passive voice me 'was/were + being + v3' hota hai. Yahan meaning ye dena hai ki 'ek book market ko operate kiya jaa raha tha'.

Verb Test 1.question: He uses to study / till 11 P.M. / and then goes before / the library closes.
Verb Test 1.solution: Use 'studies' in place of 'uses to study'. poore sentence ko padh ke pata chal raha hai ki yahan present ke habitual action ki baat ho rahi hai isliye yahan present indefinite tense lagega jisme verb ki first form use hoti hai. Yahan koi past ki habit nahi hai.

Verb Test 1.question: Every night I am / in the habit of hearing/ the news on the Radio
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use listening to in place of hearing.
listen - intentionally kisi cheez ko sunna.
hear- koi cheez sunai de jaana.

Verb Test 1.question: The audience has being / angry as the magician / is not performing/ as expected.
Verb Test 1.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘has being’ kyunki has ke baad 'ing' form nahi aayegi. Yahan meaning ye dena hai ki audience gusse me hai kyunki magician waisa perform nahi kar rha jaisa expected tha. Iske liye 'the audience is angry' likhna best rahega.

Verb Test 1.question: I have friends/ who should love / to stay at home, / but they have to go to work.
options: but they have to go to work.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use 'would' in place of 'should'.
yeh modal ke meaning par based error hai.
friends who should love to stay at home = friends jinhe ghar par rehna pasand karna chahiye.
friends who would love to stay at home = friends jo ghar par rehna pasand karenge.

Verb Test 1.question: The Desais soon / got used to live / in the country.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use 'got used to living' in place of 'got used to live’ here the structure is :-
got - linking verb
used - adjective (sub complement) (aadi hona)
to- fix preposition
living- gerund (object of preposition)

Verb Test 1.question: The man who / was committed / the theft last night / was caught this evening.
Verb Test 1.solution: Remove 'was’ 'man' commit action doer hai isliye verb active form me aayegi isliye 'was' ko hatana hoga kyunki 'was+verb' ki 3rd form passive voice hoti hai.

Verb Test 1.question: Every morning / he might kiss / his beloved / and set off for work.
Verb Test 1.solution: Use 'used to or would' in place of 'might'. kyunki yahan hume past ki habit show karni hai.

Verb Test 1.question: When the allotted time /was over they torn off /the papers which they had used.
options: the papers which they had used
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use 'tore' in place of 'torn’.
tear tore torn
'tore' verb ki 2nd form hai aur 'torn' 3rd form hai. Yahan 2 past ke actions ki baat ho rahi hai isliye yahan verb ki 2nd form aayegi.

Verb Test 1.question: Psychology has been / defined the scientific study of / human psyche and behaviour.
Verb Test 1.solution:
use ‘defined as the’ instead of ‘defined the’
kyunki kuchh esi verbs hoti hai jinke baad 'as' ka use kiya jaata hai. like - define, regard, describe, treat, know etc
kyunki in verbs me generally esa meaning banta hai 'kisi ko kisi ke jaisa manna'
eg - Kalidasa is known as the Shakespeare of India.

Verb Test 1.question: The unreasonable behaviour /of his daughter / was thoroughly /upset Mr. Gupta.
Verb Test 1.solution:
use 'upset' in place of 'was upset’.
kyunki yahan active voice ka use hoga na ki passive ka. Yahan meaning yeh hai ki:- uski daughter ke unreasonable behaviour ne Mr. Gupta ko poori tarah se upset kar diya.

Verb Test 1.question: The child cut his /finger with a razor /and bleeded profusely
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘bled’ in place of ‘bleeded’.
kyunki 'bleed' verb ki forms ese chalti hain-
bleed        bled           bled

Verb Test 1.question: The knight was received / compliments from the king /for his bravery.
Verb Test 1.solution: Use ‘received ’ in place of ‘was received ’ kyunki yahan passive voice nahi active voice ki zarurat hai. Passive me verb ka object nahi hota yahan 'compliments' object hai.

Verb Test 1.question: The criminal /will certainly be hung /because the charges brought upon /him are very serious.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use 'hanged' in place of 'hung.'
hang hung hung (लटकाना)
hang hanged hanged(फांसी दनेा)

Verb Test 1.question: Whatever one may say/ of him,/ none dare call on question / his honesty of purpose.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use 'dares to call' in place of 'dare call’.
Yahan koi 'not' wala ya interrogative structure nahi ban raha isliye yahan 'dare' ko 'main verb' manenge isliye uske baad call ko 'to call' karenge kyunki 2 verbs ek sath nahi aayengi.
Note:- None ke baad generally singular verb prefer ki jaati hai.

Verb Test 1.question: When the villagers put up a firm resistance to the fearsome bandit with all their might, he ultimately fleed the spot.
options: When the villagers put up a firm resistance to the fearsome bandit with all their might, he ultimately fled the spot.
When the villagers put up a firm resistance to the fearsome bandit with all their might, he ultimately flew the spot.
When the villagers putted up a firm resistance to the fearsome bandit with all their might, he ultimately fleed the spot.
When the villagers put up a firm resistance to the fearsome bandit with all their might, he ultimately flown the spot.
Verb Test 1.solution:
use ‘fled’ instead of ‘fleed’
kyunki 'flee' verb ki 2nd and 3rd dono form 'fled' hi hoti hai.
Flee – Fled - Fled

Verb Test 1.question: When I was young./ i can run /faster than mohan.
Verb Test 1.solution: Use ‘could’ in place of ‘can’. kyunki yahan 'past' ki baat ho rahi hai.

Verb Test 1.question: I never considered him to be a person who would / go back on his promise and / then do not even apologise.
options: I never considered him to be a person who would
go back on his promise and
Verb Test 1.solution:
Remove 'do' kyunki yahan 2 verbs 'and' conjuction se jodi gayi hai isliye 2nd verb apologise se pehle bhi 'would' modal understood hai.
who would go back on his promise and then (would) not even apologise.

Verb Test 1.question: As soon as we went for an afternoon siesta, my pet rabbit Tia digged a huge hole right in the middle of the lawn.
options: As soon as we gone for an afternoon siesta, my pet rabbit Tia digged a huge hole right in the middle of the lawn.
As soon as we gone for an afternoon siesta, my pet rabbit Tia dug a huge hole right in the middle of the lawn.
As soon as we were going for an afternoon siesta, my pet rabbit Tia digged a huge hole right in the middle of the lawn.
As soon as we went for an afternoon siesta, my pet rabbit Tia dug a huge hole right in the middle of the lawn.
Verb Test 1.solution:
use ‘dug’ instead of ‘digged’ kyunki 'dig' verb ki 2nd and 3rd dono form 'dug' hi hoti hai.
Dig – Dug - Dug

Verb Test 1.question: A soldier / could fight / for his country and save his county’s honour.
options: for his country and save his county’s honour.
Verb Test 1.solution:
Use 'must' in place of 'could'.
yeh modal verb ke meaning par based error hai.
A soldier could fight for his country = ek soldier apne desh ke liye lad sakta hai.
A soldier must fight for his country =  ek soldier ko apne desh ke liye zarur ladna chahiye.

Verb Test 1.question: Would you liked / to have / some fries / along with your coffee, / sir?” / asked the waiter.
Verb Test 1.solution: use ‘like’ instead of ‘liked’ kyunki modal verbs ke baad verb ki 'base form' ka use kiya jaata hai.

Verb Test 2.question: He may live long”/ his sad mother/ prayed.
Verb Test 2.solution:
Use 'may he live long' in place of 'He may live long'. kyunki yeh ek optative sentence hai.
Note:- yahan 'may' ki jagah 'might' nahi hoga kyunki yeh direct speech me likha gya hai.

Verb Test 2.question: Raman putted the vegetables / in the frying pan / and after adding some water, / closed the lid.
Verb Test 2.solution:
Use ‘put’ instead of ‘putted' kyunki 'put' verb ki saari forms same hoti hain.
Put – Put - Put

Verb Test 2.question: If you get good marks/I shall happy/as much as you.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use 'shall be happy' in place of 'shall happy'. kyunki 'shall' ek modal hai aur 'happy' ek adjective hai toh hume shall ke baad ek esi main verb ki zarurat hai jiske baad akela adjective 'happy' aa sake isliye yahan main verb ke roop me ek linking verb 'be' ka use hoga.

Verb Test 2.question: When the villagers / were attacked, / they were raised to violence.
Verb Test 2.solution:
Use ‘roused’ in place of ‘raised’.
raise :- kisi cheez ko uthana
rouse :- kisi person ke andar kisi feeling ko jagana.

Verb Test 2.question: All those students / who are participating / in the play / have been notify / to stay back for rehearsal / after 3:00 p.m.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘have been notified’ instead of ‘have been notify’ kyunki 'students' notify action ke receiver hain isliye verb passive form me aayegi, 'have been notified' ka use hoga.

Verb Test 2.question: Why didn’t you submitted your project on time?
Verb Test 2.solution: Use 'submit' instead of 'submitted' kyunki Do/Does/Did ke baad verb ki base form ka use kiya jaata hai.

Verb Test 2.question: Electric heaters were providing to all the officers at the guest house.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘were provided’ instead of ‘were providing’ kyunki yahan passive form me verb chahiye.

Verb Test 2.question: Einstein’s school teachers thought he would never success in life.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘succeed’ instead of ‘success’ kyunki modal verbs ke baad base verb aata hai.

Verb Test 2.question: You need not tell a lie / when the judge asked you where you were / When the crime was committed.
options: You need not tell a lie
when the judge asked you where you were
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘need not have told a lie’ kyunki yeh past ka context hai.

Verb Test 2.question: If we have no definite aim before us / we would only wonder about in aimless pursuits / and achieve nothing.
options: If we have no definite aim before us
we would only wonder about in aimless pursuits
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘wander’ instead of ‘wonder’. Wander = aimlessly move; Wonder = curiosity.

Verb Test 2.question: The monkeys swinged / on the branches and / jumped over the compound wall.
Verb Test 2.solution:
Use ‘swung’ instead of ‘swinged’.
Swing – Swung – Swung

Verb Test 2.question: I can explain you the reason for the delay in executing your order.
Verb Test 2.solution: Correct: 'explain the reason' or 'explain to you the reason'. 'Explain' ka object person nahi hota.

Verb Test 2.question: Need you to buy so many books?
Verb Test 2.solution: Correct form: ‘Need you buy’. Modal structure ke according infinitive without ‘to’ aayega.

Verb Test 2.question: The doctor advised Mr. Murugan that, / because of his severe cramps, / he should lay in the bed for a few days.
options: The doctor advised Mr. Murugan that,
he should lay in the bed for a few days.
Verb Test 2.solution:
Use ‘lie’ instead of ‘lay’.
Lie = letna
Lay = letaana

Verb Test 2.question: Though the police tried all sorts of methods to illicit / information from the public / they remained silent.
options: Though the police tried all sorts of methods to illicit
Verb Test 2.solution:
Use ‘elicit’ instead of ‘illicit’.
Elicit = draw out info.
Illicit = illegal

Verb Test 2.question: I ordered his dismissal when he flouted the company rules.
Verb Test 2.solution: No error. Sentence is correct as written.

Verb Test 2.question: News of the calamity is reached the family members the next day.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘reached’ instead of ‘is reached’. Passive nahi, active form lagega.

Verb Test 2.question: Bhagat Singh lie down / his life /  for his motherland.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘laid down’ instead of ‘lie down’. Lay down = kurbaan karna.

Verb Test 2.question: The tennis player easy through the /opening set before her opponent and rallied to take the /final two sets for the biggest victory of her young career.
options: The tennis player easy through the
opening set before her opponent and rallied to take the
final two sets for the biggest victory of her young career.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘eased’ instead of ‘easy’. Adjective nahi, verb chahiye.

Verb Test 2.question: This summer, I’ve met down a lot of interesting people.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘met’ instead of ‘met down’. ‘Meet down’ koi valid phrasal verb nahi hai.

Verb Test 2.question: I use to going for a morning walk when I was living in Dehradun.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘used to go’ instead of ‘use to going’. 'Used to' + base verb past habit dikhata hai.

Verb Test 2.question: You may ask / someone where the ship / is bounded for.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘bound’ instead of ‘bounded’. 'Bound for' = heading toward a destination.

Verb Test 2.question: The problems that  our/ country has and will face / are the outcome of the selfishness /of our so called saviors.
options: are the outcome of the selfishness
Verb Test 2.solution: Use 'has faced and will face'. 'Has' ke baad v3 aata hai; 'will' ke baad base verb.

Verb Test 2.question: They made her as the Chairperson of their bank.
Verb Test 2.solution: Remove 'as'. 'Make someone Chairperson' structure hota hai. Comparison nahi ho raha.

Verb Test 2.question: It is be said that in 2019 the Indian Stock Market will fall drastically and we can expect that fall very soon.
options: the Indian Stock Market will fall
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘It is said’ or ‘It is being said’. 'is be' incorrect structure hai.

Verb Test 2.question: Most of my friends/ heard the earthquake / but I was totally unaware of it.
options: but I was totally unaware of it.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘felt’ instead of ‘heard’. Earthquake feel hota hai, suna nahi jaata.

Verb Test 2.question: The President/overtakes/in Bangladesh.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘takes over’ instead of ‘overtakes’. 'Take over' = assume responsibility; 'overtake' = aage nikalna.

Verb Test 2.question: Our equipment gets damage/very often in summer because/there are frequent power cuts.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘damaged’ instead of ‘damage’. 'Get' ke baad past participle (v3) lagta hai.

Verb Test 2.question: It was a windy autumn day and leaves were fallen rapidly from the trees.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘falling’ instead of ‘fallen’. Continuous action show ho rahi hai, passive nahi.

Verb Test 2.question: He transferred/the melted iron/in a large container.
Verb Test 2.solution: Use ‘molten’ instead of ‘melted’. 'Molten' is adjective used for metal; 'melted' is verb form.

Noun Test 1.question: The boy had run away / because he couldn’t stand / his father beat him / for one more day.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use 'his father's beating' instead of 'his father beat' sentence ka meaning yeh hai ki- ''wo ladka bhaag gya tha kyunki wo bardashta nahi kar paaya apne pita ki maar ko''. 'Could not stand' verb ka object 'beating' gerund banega aur usse pehle likhe 'father' noun ko possessive case me karke father's karna padega.

Noun Test 1.question: Mother-in-laws from different / daily soaps have been / nominated for this category.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use 'mothers-in-law' in place of 'mother-in-laws'. Compound noun ka plural karne ke liye noun ki tarah act karne wale word ka plural karte hain.

Noun Test 1.question: My neighbour’s grandson / is only / five month old.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘months’ instead of ‘month’ kyunki 'five' ek numeral adjective hai iske baad plural noun ka use hoga.

Noun Test 1.question: The efficiency of an / employee also depends on the / surrounding in which he or she works.
options: surrounding in which he or she works.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘surroundings’ in place of ‘surrounding’. Yahan 'on' preposition ka object banane ke liye ek noun ki need hai. surrounding = adjective, surroundings = noun.

Noun Test 1.question: There have been / three breaks-in / in our society / this month.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘break-ins’ instead of ‘breaks-in’ kyunki 'break-in' ka plural 'break-ins' hota hai. Yeh aapko yaad hi karna padega. Break-in - the crime of entering a building by damaging a door or window, usually in order to steal.

Noun Test 1.question: I want to know / where the headquarter of / Delhi police is situated.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘headquarters’ in place of ‘headquarter’. 'headquarters' un nouns me se hai jinki singular and plural me spelling same hi rehti hai.

Noun Test 1.question: We bought / two dozens / mangoes from / the market.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘two dozen’ instead of ‘two dozens’ kyunki yahan 'two dozen' ko 'mangoes' noun ke liye adjective ki tarah use kiya jaa raha hai isliye iska plural nahi hoga.

Noun Test 1.question: Some seats are / reserved for disabled / in each compartment.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use 'the disabled' or 'disabled people' in place of disabled. Yahan 'for' preposition ka object banane ke liye noun ki zarurat hai. Jiska matlab hota hai 'handicapped people'. the disabled = disabled people

Noun Test 1.question: I do not / like to read / these kind / of novels.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘this kind’ or ‘these kinds’ instead of ‘these kind'. Plural noun ke sath 'these' and singular noun ke sath 'this' ka use hoga.

Noun Test 1.question: The balance in his saving / account is not enough for him to / avail himself of these facilities.
options: account is not enough for him to
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘savings’ in place of ‘saving’. 'Savings' and 'earnings' humesha plural me hi likhe jaate hain.

Noun Test 1.question: Shall / we go / for walking / in the park?
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘a walk’ in place of ‘walking’. Kyunki go ke baad 'walk', 'ride', 'run', 'swim' jaise verbs ka jab fixed expression hota hai tab unke sath 'for a' ka use kiya jaata hai. Go for a walk/ride/swim etc.

Noun Test 1.question: The President of India / constitutional power is limitless / but it is the P.M. who is, / indeed, powerful.
options: but it is the P.M. who is,
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘India’s’ in place of ‘India’. Possessive case dikhane ke liye apostrophe s ka use hota hai. Yahan sentence ka sense hai: India's President = भारत का राष्ट्रपति

Noun Test 1.question: The Principal requested / the teacher’s / to monitor / and take care of the small children.
options: and take care of the small children.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘teachers’ in place of ‘teacher’s’. Yahan koi possession nahi ho raha isliye possessive case (apostrophe) ka use nahi hoga. Teacher's = teacher का, jabki yahan teachers = शिक्षकगण chahiye.

Noun Test 1.question: There was / no money in the bank / in Dhananjay’s / and Mritunjay’s joint account.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘Dhananjay’ in place of ‘Dhananjay’s’. Jab do vyakti kisi ek hi vastu ke owner hote hain tab kewal second vyakti ke sath apostrophe lagate hain. i.e. Dhananjay and Mritunjay’s joint account.

Noun Test 1.question: All our / furnitures were / spoiled in the recent / rains and floods.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘furniture was’ in place of ‘furnitures were’. Furniture ek uncountable noun hai isliye iska plural form nahi hota. Iske sath singular verb ka use hota hai.

Noun Test 1.question: The offsprings of this / species leave their parents / as soon as they mature.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘offspring’ in place of ‘offsprings’. Offspring aisa noun hai jiska singular aur plural form same hota hai jaise – species, deer, sheep, aircraft, etc.

Noun Test 1.question: Doctors say that home isolation is far more effective than hospitalize in cases of mild infection.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘hospitalization’ in place of ‘hospitalize’. Hospitalization – the process of admitting someone into hospital. Isolate – verb hota hai, Isolation – noun. Comparison same parts of speech ke beech hoti hai.

Noun Test 1.question: He did not know even / the name of the scientist / who discovered / the laws of the earth gravitational force.
options: the laws of the earth gravitational force.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘earth’s’ in place of ‘earth’. Possessive case me earth ko earth’s karna hoga kyunki gravitational force ka sambandh earth se hai.

Noun Test 1.question: Your advices were timely / and guided me / to take the right decisions.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘pieces of advice’ in place of ‘advices’. Advice ek uncountable noun hai isliye iska plural form nahi hota.

Noun Test 1.question: His maid servant / behaviour is undoubtedly / indecent but I don’t / understand how he tolerates it.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘servant’s behaviour’ in place of ‘maid servant behaviour’. Possessive case dikhane ke liye apostrophe s ka use hoga. maid servant’s behaviour = नौकरानी का व्यवहार

Noun Test 1.question: She speaks / very highly / of both her / daughter-in-laws.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘daughters-in-law’ instead of ‘daughter-in-laws’ kyunki 'daughter-in-law' ka plural 'daughters-in-law' hota hai.

Noun Test 1.question: It was India’s / past glory / that attracted / a number of invaders in the remote past.
options: a number of invaders in the remote past.
Noun Test 1.solution:
No error.
Note :- Country and city ke name ke sath apostrophe laga sakte hain.
India's population = population of India
Delhi's pollution = pollution of Delhi.

Noun Test 1.question: His loyalty / and honesty / are above / suspect.
Noun Test 1.solution:
Use ‘suspicion’ instead of ‘suspect’.
above suspicion = sandeh ke pare
Suspect – a person who is believed to be guilty of something.
Suspicion – a belief or idea that something may or may not be true.

Noun Test 1.question: Many of us don’t / know the exact reason / of the earthquake.
Noun Test 1.solution:
Use ‘cause’ in place of ‘reason’.
Apne aap hone wale events ki wajah ke liye 'cause' word ka use karte hai.

Noun Test 1.question: His mean / are very limited / yet he does not curtail / his expenditure and spends lavishly.
Noun Test 1.solution:
Use ‘means’ in place of ‘mean’.
'Income/resources' wale meaning me means word ka hi use hota hai iske sath verb plural aati hai.

Noun Test 1.question: The information you are asking for is quite irrelevance.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘irrelevant’ instead of ‘irrelevance’ kyunki 'irrelevance' ek noun hai jabki 'irrelevant' ek adjective aur yahan adjective ki zarurat hai na ki noun ki.

Noun Test 1.question: Anu saw / her shade / in the river.
Noun Test 1.solution:
Use ‘shadow’ in place of ‘shade’.
shadow = parchhai
shade = dhoop se chhaya.

Noun Test 1.question: The man played the flute and led all the mouse out of the town.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘mice’ instead of ‘mouse’ kyunki 'mouse' ka plural 'mice' hota hai.

Noun Test 1.question: The French / have strange / habits.
Noun Test 1.solution:
Use ‘customs’ in place of ‘habits’.
Ek single person ki aadat ke liye 'habit' word ka use hota hai aur society me koi aadat jisko sab follow karte hain uske liye 'custom (rivaaz)' word ka use hota hai.

Noun Test 1.question: He loses his tempers on the slightest provocation.
Noun Test 1.solution: Use ‘temper’ instead of ‘tempers’ kyunki 'temper' ek uncountable noun hai iska plural form nahi hota hai.

Noun Test 2.question: The Commonwealth Games had a grand opening ceremony with spectacular cultural performings.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘performances’ instead of ‘performings’ kyunki 'perform' verb ki noun form 'performance' hoti hai, 'performing' ko gerund maan ke use nahi kar sakte kyunki gerund ki plural form nahi hoti.

Noun Test 2.question: The long-distance train / which met with an accident / was carrying some army personal.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘personnel’ in place of ‘personal’.
personal = niji
personnel = staff

Noun Test 2.question: The publics are not satisfied with the new act.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘the public is’ instead of ‘the publics are’ kyunki 'public' noun ko generally singular form me hi use kiya jaata hai.

Noun Test 2.question: Your son’s-in-law’s / friend is seriously ill / and he wants you / to see him as soon as possible.
options: to see him as soon as possible.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘sons-in-law’s friend’ or ‘son-in-law's friend’ in place of ‘son’s-in-law’s friend’.
sons-in-law’s friend = damadon ka friend
son-in-law's friend = damaad ka friend

Noun Test 2.question: They had to wait for the luggages to be put into the cab before they themselves got into it.
options: to be put into the cab
before they themselves got into it
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘luggage’ instead of ‘luggages’ kyunki luggage ek uncountable noun hai iska plural form nahi hota hai.

Noun Test 2.question: The modern man is busy acquiring more and more wealth and designing ways to invest it in more sense pleasures.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘sensuous’ instead of ‘sense’ kyunki 'pleasure' ek noun hai iske pehle adjective ka use hoga. 'sense' ek noun hai aur 'sensuous' ek adjective hai.

Noun Test 2.question: The survey gives / us much knowledge of the / public’s opinion / on the matter of terrorism.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘public’ in place of ‘public’s’ kyunki 'public opinion' ek compound noun ya fixed expression hai.

Noun Test 2.question: Among the reasons cited by the employee for quitting the job were the pressure of work, the outstation duties and desiring to pursue her hobbies.
options: Among the reasons cited by the employee
and desiring to pursue her hobbies
were the pressure of work, the outstation duties
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘desire’ instead of ‘desiring’ kyunki yahan 'pressure of work', 'the outstation duties' and 'desire to pursue her hobbies' in teen nouns ko join karna tha isliye yahan sentence me ek similarity banaye rakhne ke liye 'desire' noun ka use hoga na ki 'desiring' gerund ka. Grammar me is concept ko parallelism kehte hain.

Noun Test 2.question: ‘Language consists of several stratums’, / said a linguist / in his lecture on Language / and Linguistics.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘strata’ in place of ‘stratums’. 'Stratum' ka plural 'strata' hota hai.

Noun Test 2.question: The chart papers were distributed among all the childrens.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘children’ instead of ‘childrens’ kyunki 'children' khud hi plural noun hai, iska plural nahi hota hai.

Noun Test 2.question: Your tone of speaking / as well as your friends / is really extremely sarcastic / yet we never take it seriously.
options: yet we never take it seriously.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘friend’s’ in place of ‘friends’. Kyunki sentence ke meaning ke according 'friend' ka tone par possession banana hai.

Noun Test 2.question: My visiting to my family are few and far between.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘my visits to’ instead of ‘my visiting to’ kyunki 'visit' ek noun ban sakta hai aur 'are' verb se pata chal raha hai ki yahan plural noun ka use kiya gaya hai. Gerund ka plural form nahi hota. Note: Agar noun lag sakta ho toh jabardasti gerund nahi lagate.

Noun Test 2.question: He did not approve / of his son raising / stupid questions and thereby / vexing the teacher.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘son’s’ in place of ‘son’. Yahan meaning dena hai ki usne approve nahi kiya uske son ka stupid questions raise karna. Yahan 'approve of' phrasal verb ka object 'raising' gerund banega. Isliye 'son' noun ko possessive case me karna padega.
