Noun Test 2.question: These stray cattles are roaming around the town.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘cattle’ instead of ‘cattles’ kyunki 'cattle' khud hi ek plural noun hai.

Noun Test 2.question: You shall get / all the informations / if you read this book carefully.
options: if you read this book carefully.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘information’ in place of ‘informations’ kyunki 'information' uncountable noun hai iska plural nahi hota.

Noun Test 2.question: We have taken on / the responsibility of / arranging the required training / and supervise of the new staff.
options: and supervise of the new staff
Noun Test 2.solution: Use 'supervising the new staff' in place of 'supervise of the new staff'. Yahan arranging and supervising gerunds ko 'and' se joda gaya hai isliye parallelism ke according gerund use hoga.

Noun Test 2.question: ‘I have never seen / such a lovely spectacles / in my life’, said / the passer-by.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘spectacle’ in place of ‘spectacles’. Spectacles = chasma; spectacle = drashya. Sentence ke meaning ke according yahan 'spectacle' aayega.

Noun Test 2.question: With the literacy rates in this / region as low as 10% / we need to encourage the / local people to build schools.
options: With the literacy rates in this
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘rate’ in place of ‘rates’. Kisi ek region ki literacy rate obviously ek hi hogi toh 'rate' noun ko singular me likha jayega.

Noun Test 2.question: Hectic schedules can / take a toll on anybody and / the solutions to this is / a quick holiday to some exotic location.
options: take a toll on anybody and
a quick holiday to some exotic location.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘solution’ in place of ‘solutions’. Yahan 'the solution' noun ke liye 'is' singular verb ka use hua hai aur sentence me aage 'a quick holiday' bas ek hi solution likha hai toh clear hai ki solution noun ko bhi singular me likhna padega.

Noun Test 2.question: Owing to his heavy engagement, / he could not write even the two-third / of the book of which / the publication was extend before January.
options: he could not write even the two-third
the publication was extend before January.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘two-thirds’ in place of ‘two-third’. Jab fractions ko words ki form me likhte hain toh agar numerator 1 hota hai toh last me 's' nahi aata aur agar numerator 1 ke alawa kuchh hota hai toh 's' lagta hai.
Eg. 1/3 = one third, 2/3 = two-thirds

Noun Test 2.question: Since you are unable / to repay the loan you have no alternate / but to seek / an extension.
options: to repay the loan you have no alternate
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘alternative’ after ‘alternate’.

alternative = other option
alternate = ek chhod ke ek

eg: I go there on alternate days.

Noun Test 2.question: Some required measures / have to be taken to increase / the proceed of the annual sale.
options: have to be taken to increase
the proceed of the annual sale.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘proceeds’ in place of ‘proceed’.

proceed (verb) = aage badhna
proceeds (noun) = money or other property received as the result of a sale or other transaction especially involving collateral.

Noun Test 2.question: My uncle’s secretary’s wife / is / very charming.
Noun Test 2.solution: Use ‘the wife of my uncle’s secretary’ in place of ‘my uncle’s secretary’s wife’.

Noun Test 2.question: It will take at least / one and a half year / to complete this project.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘years’ in place of ‘year’.

‘one and a half’ = 1 + 1/2
Iske sath verb aur noun plural aayenge.

Noun Test 2.question: The karkarduama court has issued / five summons against him / so far, but he / has attended to none of them.
options: has attended to none of them.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘summonses’ in place of ‘summons’.

‘summons’ (singular)
‘summonses’ (plural)

Noun Test 2.question: I do not / know / my date of birth.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘the date of my birth’ in place of ‘my date of birth’.

Informal ya spoken me 'my date of birth' hi bolte hain but grammar ke according ‘the date of my birth’ sahi usage hai.

Noun Test 2.question: The extra benefits in addition to its / flexibility of operation / and superior finish makes / it the most desirable machine of its kind.
options: The extra benefits in addition to its
it the most desirable machine of its kind.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘make’ in place of ‘makes’.

Is verb ka subject ‘extra benefits’ hai jo ki plural hai.

Noun Test 2.question: Cannot you see / that the cattle / is grazing in the field? / So, you cannot play there.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘are’ in place of ‘is’.

‘cattle’ plural noun hai uske liye plural verb aayegi.

Noun Test 2.question: The gentry of Mumbai does not / like Salman Khan at / all, even though he has / number of good movies to his credit.
options: The gentry of Mumbai does not
number of good movies to his credit.
Noun Test 2.solution:
Use ‘do’ in place of ‘does’.

‘gentry’ plural noun hai uske liye verb plural aayegi.

Noun Test 2.question: Would you please / tell me how many / soaps do you / use in a month.
Noun Test 2.solution: 'Soap' uncountable noun hai iska direct's ya 'es' laga ke plural nahi kar sakte hai. ek se zyada soaps kehne ke liye 'cakes' ya 'bars of soap' likhna padega.

Adverb Test 1.question: Select the sentence with the appropriate use of adverb of manner.
options: He has just done his work.
He has done his work on my table
Adverb Test 1.solution:
(c) Regularly – Adverb of frequency
Just – adverb of time
Carefully – adverb of manner

Adverb Test 1.question: We seldom or ever/ go out these days/ because it is too cold now a days.
options: because it is too cold now a days
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘seldom or never’ in place of ‘seldom or ever.’
Yeh meaning based question hai.
seldom if ever - kabhi-kabhar.
seldom or never- na ke barabar.

Adverb Test 1.question: The child was / gazing longingly / at the toy.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
(c)
longingly = adverb (chahat ke sath.)

Adverb Test 1.question: Though he was brave / he could not face the ups and downs / of life manly.
options: he could not face the ups and downs
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use in ‘manfully/like a man/ a manly manner’ in place of ‘manly’. Yahan 'could not face' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai aur 'manly' ek adjective hota hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: Select the sentence with the appropriate use of adverb of frequency.
options: Radha goes to Nagpur with great affection.
Radha goes to Nagpur for her office work.
Radha goes to Nagpur to meet her uncle.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
(c)
often adverb of frequency (aksar)

Adverb Test 1.question: He was fortunately / not present on / the rostrum when / the bomb exploded.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘Fortunately he was’ in place of ‘He was fortunately.’
kyunki 'fortunately' yahan sentence adverb hai isliye sentence ke shuru me use hogi.

Adverb Test 1.question: He describes the place vivid / that inspired in us / a wish to visit / the same.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘vividly’ instead of ‘vivid’ kyunki yahan 'describe' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai 'vivid' ek adjective hai aur 'vividly' adverb hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: This room is very / beautiful but too much / small to accommodate / all of you.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use 'much too' in place of 'too much.' kyunki yahan 'small' adjective ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai.
too much = adjective
much too = adverb

Adverb Test 1.question: He always / aimed highly / in life.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
(c) use ‘high’ instead of ‘highly’

high(adjective) – ooncha
eg. the house has a high wall
high(adverb) - ooncha ya value ya amount me zyada.
he jumped very high.
You should aim higher in life.
highly(adverb) - very, in praise
he is highly successful.
he speaks highly of you.
(wo tumhari bahut tareef karta hai)

Adverb Test 1.question: Hardly he likes / to hear my name / after the rift which occurred / between him and me.
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use ‘Hardly does he like’ in place of ‘Hardly he likes.’ kyunki ye sentence 'hardly' adverb se shuru hua hai isliye inversion ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 1.question: Bobo was / very richer than Jim / as he had illicitly accumulated / all his wealth.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘much’ instead of ‘very’ kyunki comparative degree ko qualify karne ke liye 'much' ka use kiya jaata hai aur positive degree ke liye 'very' ka.

Adverb Test 1.question: Although he only earns / six hundred rupees a month / he manages to support / his family.
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use ‘earns only’ in place of ‘only earns’. kyunki yahan meaning ye dena hai ki wo sirf 600 rupees kamata hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: Her concerts / are very admired / by the foreigners /no error.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
(a) use ‘much’ instead of ‘very’ kyunki past participle ko qualify karne ke liye 'much' ka use kiya jaata hai aur present participle ke liye 'very' ka.
Exception :- kuchh past participles ke sath bhi 'very' lagaya jaate hai.
eg. very tired, very dejected, very contented, very discontented, very pleased, very drunk, very delighted etc.

Adverb Test 1.question: I am / quite absolutely / fine so I don't / need your help.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (b) remove 'absolutely' after 'quite.' kyunki 'quite' apne aap me ek absolute adverb hai iske sath aur adverb nahi lagate.

Adverb Test 1.question: He was / paid handsomely for / his ability to handle / the crowd skillful.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (c) use ‘skillfully’ instead of ‘skillful’ kyunki yahan 'handle' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai 'skillful' ek adjective hai aur 'skillfully' ek adverb hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: I never remember / to have met a more intelligent / man in my life.
options: to have met a more intelligent
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use 'I remember never to have met a more intelligent man in my life.' or 'I don't remember to have met a more intelligent man in my life.' in place of 'I never remember to have met a more intelligent man in my life'

Yeh meaning based error hai.

I never remember to have met a more intelligent man in my life.
=main kabhi yaad nahi rakhta isse intelligent aadmi se milna meri zindagi me.

I remember never to have met a more intelligent man in my life.
= mujhe yaad hai main kabhi nahi mila isse zyada intelligent aadmi se meri zindagi me.

I don't remember to have met a more intelligent man in my life.
= mujhe yaad nahi ki main mila hun isse zyada intelligent aadmi se meri zindagi me.

Adverb Test 1.question: He does not / know how to / draw quickly / and straightly.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘straight’ instead of ‘straightly’ kyunki adjective and adverb form dono straight hi hoti hain.

Adverb Test 1.question: The man was / reportedly upset / over his sister’s death / about a fortnight behind.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘ago’ in place of ‘behind.’ kyunki past indefinite ke sath 'ago' ka use hota hai aur iske sath time bhi diya hai.
2 months ago
5 hours ago

Adverb Test 1.question: She is quiet a generous woman / to have donated / such a large amount / for the flood affected people.
options: She is quiet a generous woman
Adverb Test 1.solution:
(d) use ‘quite’ instead of ‘quiet’.
Quiet (adj) - making very little noise.
Quite (adv) – completely.

Adverb Test 1.question: We admired / his many / attempts bravely / to enter the burning building.
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use 'brave attempts' in place of 'attempts bravely'. sentence ke meaning ke according yahan 'bravely' 'admire' verb ke liye nahi aa sakta. 'brave' ko adjective bana ke attempts ke liye use kiya jayega.

Adverb Test 1.question: My granny says that / it is quite all right / to get married young, / though I do not absolute agree with her a bit on this.
options: though I do not absolute agree with her a bit on this
Adverb Test 1.solution: (b) use ‘absolutely’ instead of ‘absolute’ kyunki yahan 'agree' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai 'absolute' ek adjective hai aur 'absolutely' ek adverb hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: They are working on / a rather interesting project which / will prove a boon to / those living in rural areas
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use ‘fairly interesting’ in place of ‘rather interesting.’ fairly को favourable adjective (tareef karne wale adjective) ke sath use karte hain aur 'rather' ko generally unfavourable adjectives (burai karne wale adjectives) ke sath.

Adverb Test 1.question: She is / the very ambitious woman / I have ever / come across.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (c) use ‘most’ instead of ‘very’ kyunki yahan is woman ka comparison un sab women se ho rha hai jinse 'I' matlab speaker aaj tak mila hai isliye superlative degree ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 1.question: This world is / very much cruel to one /and all of us , however / we love to live it at best.
options: we love to live it at best
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use ‘very cruel’ in place of ‘very much cruel.’ cruel positive degree ka adjective hai iske sath 'much' ka use nahi hoga.

Adverb Test 1.question: He was enough tall / to be admitted / into the armed forces.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (d) use ‘tall enough’ instead of ‘enough tall’ kyunki 'enough' adverb ka use adjective ke baad kiya jaata hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: Of course , you are going / to be a winner, / if you continue to work / with the same spirit.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘Certainly’ in place of ‘Of course.’

certainly- koi kaam jiske hone ki bahut zyada 'probability ho.

of course- koi cheez jo obvious ho.
eg. You will certainly pass the exam, you study hard.
Of course blood is the thicker that water.

Adverb Test 1.question: The helicopter of the enemies / hovered exact / over their bunker.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (b) use ‘exactly’ instead of ‘exact' kyunki yahan 'over the bunker' adverbial phrase of place ko qualify krane ke liye ek adverb ki need hai isliye 'exactly' adverb aayega na ki 'exact' adjective.

Adverb Test 1.question: I presently received / a piece of news and / it is so shocking that I do not / want to break it to others.
options: it is so shocking that I do not
want to break it to others.
Adverb Test 1.solution: Use ‘I have just received’ in place of ‘I presently received.’ kyunki sentence ka meaning yeh dena hai ki news just abhi mili hai. Presently future action ke liye use hota hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: The child was irritable / because she had not / soundly slept / the previous night.
Adverb Test 1.solution: (a) use ‘slept soundly’ instead of ‘soundly slept’ kyunki 'adverb of manner' ka use intransitive verb me verb ke baad hota hai.

Adverb Test 1.question: He is too intelligent / to handle the / situation in a / successful manner.
Adverb Test 1.solution:
Use ‘intelligent enough’ in place of ‘too intelligent.’
'too' ka use 'zarurat se zyada' (negative sense) me karte hain. Yahan positive me paryapt wala meaning dena hai isliye 'enough' ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: The old man climbed seven floors with hardly no effort at all.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(d) use ‘any’ instead of ‘no’ kyunki 'hardly' aur 'no' dono negative words hain
Dono ek sath use nahi kiye jayenge, isliye 'hardly' ke baad ek neutral word 'any' lagana padega.

Adverb Test 2.question: My last journey was / none too pleasant and i enjoyed / the allowing sights of flora and fauna / through the tinsel window pan.
options: none too pleasant and i enjoyed
the allowing sights of flora and fauna
Adverb Test 2.solution:
Use ‘only too’ in place of ‘none too.’
none too = not very
only too = very
Yahan 'very' wala meaning dena hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: This question / is quite too / simple for me / to answer.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (b) Remove ‘quite’ kyunki 'quite' ke sath aur koi adverb use nahi karte but aage infinitive diya hai aur 'too + infinitive' ka pair hota hai isliye 'quite' ko hi remove krna padega.

Adverb Test 2.question: So hoarse/he was that he could/not make the speech.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
Use was he in place of he was.
'so + adverb of manner' se sentence shuru hua hai, aage inversion ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: There is a very little time / for them to prepare / for the show.
options: There is a very little time
Adverb Test 2.solution: use ‘too little time’ instead of ‘a very little time’ . sentence me aage infinitive hai isliye 'too' ka use hoga kyunki 'too+infinitive' ka pair hota hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: We should/ keep our belongings/ orderly.
Adverb Test 2.solution: Use in an orderly manner in place of orderly. Yahan 'keep' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai but 'orderly' ek adjective hota hai. Isliye 'in an orderly manner' adverbial phrase ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: Aarav’s mother / speaks four languages / fluently.
Adverb Test 2.solution: 'speak' verb ke liye 'fluently' adverb ka use hua hai. Is sentence me koi error nahi hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: She does her / work good as she / is a trained nurse.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
Use well in place of good
'does' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai isliye 'well' ka use hoga.
good = adjective
well = adverb

Adverb Test 2.question: The birds flew / fastly above / as we stood / on our terrace.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (c) use ‘fast’ instead of ‘fastly’ kyunki 'fast' ki adjective and adverb form 'fast' hi hoti hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: You will find everybody / Saying that it is / the much best movie / ever made in the Indian film industry.
options: ever made in the Indian film industry
Adverb Test 2.solution: Use 'much the best' or 'by far the best' in place of ‘the much best.’ superlative degree ki intensity badhane ke liye 'much the' ya 'by far the' ka use hota hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: The thief / entered the house, / in the middle of the night, / quiet.
options: in the middle of the night
Adverb Test 2.solution: (d) use ‘quietly’ instead of ‘quiet’ kyunki yahan 'entered' verb ko qualify karne le liye adverb ki need hai 'quiet' ek adjective hai aur 'quietly' ek adverb hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: Not only we lost / what we had on our disposal / but we also / lost our patience.
options: what we had on our disposal
Adverb Test 2.solution:
Use did we lose in place of we lost.
'not only' se sentence start hua hai isliye aage inversion ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: The careful crafted personality / of Anahita / did not help her much / in the electoral campaign.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (a) use ‘carefully’ instead of ‘careful’ kyunki yahan 'crafted' past participle (semi verb) ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki need hai, 'careful' ek adjective hai aur 'carefully' ek adverb hai

Adverb Test 2.question: He asked me to / completely forget her /but only I know / how easy it is to say so.
options: how easy it is to say so
Adverb Test 2.solution: Use 'to forget her completely' in place of 'to completely forget her' kyunki infinitive ko split nahi karte aur adverb of manner 'completely' jo forget ke liye aaya hai use 'forget' ke object 'her' ke baad use krenge.

Adverb Test 2.question: The students / and the teachers / worked hardly / to make the event a success.
options: to make the event a success
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(d) use ‘hard’ instead of ‘hardly’

Hard - with a lot of physical or mental effort:
Hardly - only just; almost not:

Adverb Test 2.question: Only by working / hard you can /succeed in this exam.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (b) Use 'can you succeed' in place of 'you can succeed'. adverb of manner se shuruaat hui hai aage inversion ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: You must avoid riding in a crowded bus / or travelling in a metro / during rush hour / as both are quiet unpleasant experiences.
options: You must avoid riding in a crowded bus
as both are quiet unpleasant experiences
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(c) use ‘quite’ instead of ‘quiet’

Quiet (adj) - making very little noise.
Quite (adv) – completely.

Adverb Test 2.question: She makes often these / types of mistakes that’s why / Mrs. Gomati always shouts at her.
options: Mrs. Gomati always shouts at her.
Adverb Test 2.solution: Use often makes in place of makes often. kyunki 'often' indefinite adverb of frequency hai jiski position verb se pehle rakhi jaati hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: Deepu’s mother / has repeated asked him / to lower the volume / of his mobile.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (a) use ‘repeatedly’ instead of ‘repeated’ kyunki yahan 'asked' verb ko qualify karne liye adverb ki zarurat hai 'repeated' ek adjective hai aur 'repeatedly' ek adverb hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: She reacted /yesterday very strangely / when I told her that I / had won a lottery.
options: when I told her that I
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(b) replace 'yesterday very strangely' with 'very strangely yesterday' .correct sequence of adverbs

MANNER - PLACE - TIME

Adverb Test 2.question: We are yet living in the same house.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (d) use ‘still’ instead of ‘yet’ kyunki 'yet' ka use negative sentence me kiya jaata hai aur 'still' ka use affirmative sentence me kiya jaata hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: Nobody has ever listened to me so attentive.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (a) use ‘attentively’ instead of ‘attentive’ kyunki yahan 'listened' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb ki zarurat hai 'attentive' ek adjective hai aur 'attentively' ek adverb hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: I learnt to adapt quickly to new schools because we moved to new places quite frequent
Adverb Test 2.solution: (c) use ‘frequently’ instead of ‘frequent’ kyunki yahan 'moved' verb ko qualify karne ke liye adverb zarurat hai 'frequent' ek adjective hai aur 'frequently' ek adverb hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: No matter he tries hard he cannot play the guitar.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (b) use ‘No matter how hard he tries’ instead of ‘No matter he tries hard’. kyunki yahan sentence ka meaning ye hai ki 'koi farq nahi padta wo kitni bhi try kar le wo guitar nahi seekh sakta. isliye 'no matter how hard he tries' ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: They can't hardly believe that Article 370 is no longer valid in Jammu and Kashmir.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (d) Use 'can hardly believe' or ‘can't believe’ in place of ‘can’t hardly believe' kyunki 'double negative' ek sath use nahi honge.

Adverb Test 2.question: Found in many parts of India, the frangipani tree is a small, low –branching tree which is especial used for several medicinal purposes.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(d) replace 'especial used for several medicinal purposes' with 'used especially for several medicinal purposes.’

especially ek adjective hota yahan 'khaas taur se' wala meaning dena hai 'for medicinal purposes' ke liye isliye 'especially' ka use hoga.

Adverb Test 2.question: She loved herself so more that she thought of no one else.
Adverb Test 2.solution: (c) use ‘much’ instead of ‘more’ kyunki yahan kisi aur se comparison nahi hai toh comparative degree nahi lagegi. so adverb positive degree adjective ke liye aati hai ye bhi ek hint hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: I know that he wanted to go home earliest.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(a) use ‘early या at the earliest’ instead of ‘earliest’
early - jaldi
at the earliest - jitna jaldi ho sake.

Adverb Test 2.question: He has never/ supported me, nor you have.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
nor have you. negative statement ka addition to statement structure
neither/nor + helping verb + subject banta hai.

Adverb Test 2.question: This is a most / important chapter so you / should study it carefully.
Adverb Test 2.solution:
(d) no error

Yahan is chapter ka kisi aur chapter se comparison nahi hai isliye yahan superlative degree ka use nahi hoga. 'most' adverb ka matlab 'very' bhi hota hai.

this is a most important chapter = this is a very important chapter.

Note:- agar ye sentence esa hota:
this is a most important chapter in your syllabus...
tab is chapter ka comparison syllabus ke baaki chapters se mana jaata aur tab 'a most' ki jagah 'the most' ka use karte.

Article Test 1.question: It was / the very well-directed film / and we enjoyed it.
Article Test 1.solution:
use ‘a’ instead of ‘the’ kyunki yahan movie ke baare me first time baat hui hai sentence me pehle iska koi zikr nahi hai. article ka meaning bhi 'ek' wala aa rha hai.
'veh ek well directed film thi'

Article Test 1.question: Brahmaputra is /one of the longest rivers /that originate /in the Himalyas
Article Test 1.solution: Use The before Brahmaputra. River ke name se pehle 'the' article ka use hoga.

Article Test 1.question: It was a surprising / to receive the gift/ from my brother.
Article Test 1.solution: Remove a use ‘ it was surprising/it was a surprise ’ ka use karen, kyunki article ka use noun ke liye kiya jaata hai yahan 'surprising' koi noun nahi present participle (adjective) hai.

Article Test 1.question: This is /the most important /question which you have /to prepare very carefully.
Article Test 1.solution:
Use ‘a’ in place of ‘the.’
a most important question = a very important question
Yeh adverb chapter ka concept hai. 'most' ka matlab 'very' bhi hota hai. Yahan is question ki tulna kisi aur question se nahi karni hai isliye superlative degree 'most' ka use nahi hoga.

Article Test 1.question: Antique diamond necklace / was stolen / from the museum.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘an’ before antique diamond necklace kyunki singular countable noun se pehle article lagate hain.

Article Test 1.question: He went for the lunch /at 1 pm and then /returned.
Article Test 1.solution: Remove the before lunch. kyunki meal ke name se pehle article use nahi karte.

Article Test 1.question: Athens was / a most luminous / of all city-states / of ancient Greece.
Article Test 1.solution:
use ‘the most’ instead of ‘a most’ kyunki yahan 'athens' ka greece ki baaki ancient cities ke sath comparison karna hai, isliye superlateive degree lagegi.
a most = very
the most :- superlative degree banane ke liye use hota hai.

Article Test 1.question: When the principal entered the classroom /all boys shook /in their shoes.
options: When the principal entered the classroom
Article Test 1.solution:
Use all the boys in place of all boys.
All+ the +noun = particular
All + noun = general
Yahan us particular class ke ladkon ki baat ho rahi hai isliye 'all the boys' aayega.

Article Test 1.question: Sunil refused to / attend the meeting / of association on Saturday.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the’ before association kyunki singular countable noun se pehle article lagate hain aur sentence ke meaning ke according yahan ek particular association ki baat ho rhi hai isliye 'the association' aayega.

Article Test 1.question: The stadium was full/ of spectators/ from one end to other.
Article Test 1.solution:
Use the other in place of other
Yahan meaning dena hai 'ek end se dusre end tak' toh dusra end specific hai isliye 'the other end' ka use hoga.

Article Test 1.question: Ronaldo is / a famous / player of / the football.
Article Test 1.solution: Remove ‘the’ football proper noun hai 'games' ke names ke sath article nahi lagate kyunki wo generally proper noun hote hain.

Article Test 1.question: An ancient /considered that /knowledge had its limits.
Article Test 1.solution:
Use The ancient in place of An ancient. the rich = rich people
the blind = blind people
ese hi.
the ancient = ancient people (purvaz)

Article Test 1.question: There was an interesting article in the newspaper about the dangers to an environment.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the environment’ instead of ‘an environment’ kyunki environment, atmosphere, sky, etc. ek hi hain isliye wo sabke liye same hain (speaker and listener dono ke liye) isliye unke pehle 'the' article ka use hota hai.

Article Test 1.question: I felt privileged / to recite a poem in an honour of my teacher / at a recent school function.
options: to recite a poem in an honour of my teacher
Article Test 1.solution:
Use the honour in place of an honour.
‘of my teacher’ adjectival phrase se 'honour' noun specific kiya gaya hai isliye 'the honour' ka use hoga.

Article Test 1.question: The sea has become / an cheap dumping ground / for all kinds / of waste products.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘a’ instead of ‘an’ kyunki article 'an' ka use vowel sounding words se pehle ke liye kiya jaata hai jabki article 'a' ka use consonant sounding words se pehle kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 1.question: The accelerating pace of life in our metropolitan city / has had the tremendous effect/ on the culture and life-style of the people.
options: The accelerating pace of life in our metropolitan city
on the culture and life-style of the people.
Article Test 1.solution:
Use a tremendous effect in place of the tremendous effect. Yahan tremendous effect ka jikr first time kiya gya hai aur article ka meaning 'ek' wala aa rha hai.
Culture pe ek tremendous effect.
Isliye 'a' tremendous effect' ka use hoga.

Article Test 1.question: Four of earliest civilisations / of the world / were located / on the banks of or near large rivers.
options: were located on the banks of
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the’ before earliest kyunki superlative degree ke pehle definite article 'the' ka use kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 1.question: Now that she is living in her own flat,/ she cleans the windows, / twice a week in the summer and once a week in the winter.
options: Now that she is living in her own flat,
twice a week in the  summer and once a week in the winter.
Article Test 1.solution: Remove the before ‘summer’ and ‘winter’ seasons ke name se pehle article ka use nahi karte.

Article Test 1.question: Do you mind lending me your book for a hour?
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘an’ instead of ‘a’ kyunki article 'an' ka use vowel sounding words se pehle ke liye kiya jaata hai jabki article 'a' ka use consonant sounding words se pehle kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 1.question: He has taught / me how to play / flute / without taking much time.
Article Test 1.solution:
Use the flute in place of flute.

musical instruments ke name se pehle 'the' article ka use karte hain.

Article Test 1.question: The captain scored a century in a second innings.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the’ instead of ‘a’ kyunki second ek ordinal hai aur iske use se 'innings' noun specific ho gya isliye 'the second innings' ka use hoga.

Article Test 1.question: He is not that /kind of a person who/ will go back on his words.
options: will go back on his words.
Article Test 1.solution: Use 'kind of person' in place of 'kind of a person' 'kind/type/sort + of + noun' is structure me noun se pehle article ka use nahi karte.

Article Test 1.question: Whole country applauded the courage of our soldiers.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the’ before whole generally whole adjective se pehle 'the' article ka use hota hai kyunki ye kisi definite cheez ki complete quantity ko refer karta hai.

Article Test 1.question: Children enjoy listening to/ ghost stories / especially on Halloween night.
Article Test 1.solution:
Use The Halloween night in place of Halloween night. Yahan 'special night' ki baat ho rahi hai jaise
on the diwali night
on the Christmas night
on the Halloween night

Note:- Halloween angrezon ke ek festival ka naam hai.

Article Test 1.question: When I met Akbar Padamsee, one of a pioneers of Indian art, he was 87 but still alert and active.
options: one of a pioneers of Indian art
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the’ instead of ‘a’ kyunki yahan 'pioneers' plural noun hai iske sath 'a' ka use nahi kiya jaa sakta hai, aur yahan 'pioneers' specific noun hai isliye definite article 'the' ka use karenge.

Article Test 1.question: On my request, / Navendera introduced me / to his girl friend / who is a singer and a dancer.
options: who is a singer and a dancer
Article Test 1.solution: Use a singer and dancer in place of a singer and a dancer. ek hi person ko refer karne ke liye jab 2 nouns likhe jayen toh article sirf pehle wale ke sath lagate hain.

Article Test 1.question: Most of voters in Taiwan seem to have once again voted for the democratic party and President Tsai Ing-wen.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘Most of the voters in taiwan' in place of 'most of voters in taiwan' kyunki yahan 'voters' specific hain 'taiwan ke voters' isliye definite article 'the' ka use krenge.

Article Test 1.question: Gold / of South Africa / is exported to many countries.
Article Test 1.solution: Use The gold in place of Gold. Yahan specific type ke gold ki baat ho rahi hai.

Article Test 1.question: I think Virat Kohli will remain the captain of the Indian team in a year 2020.
Article Test 1.solution: use ‘the’ instead of ‘a’ kyunki yahan 'particular year' ki baat ho rhi hai isliye 2020 ek specific noun hai isliye definite article 'the' ka use karenge.

Article Test 1.question: The honesty / is one of the most essential qualities / for anyone to get respect in society.
options: is one of the most essential qualities
for anyone to get respect in society.
Article Test 1.solution: Remove the before honesty. kyunki 'honesty' ek abstract noun hai jo yahan generalised sense me use ho rha hai isliye isse pehle kisi article ka use nahi hoga.

Article Test 2.question: We were busy at the work and went for lunch only at 30 pm.
Article Test 2.solution:
Remove ‘the’ kyunki 'at work/home' ye kuchh ek fix phrases hain.
Note :- ese fix phrases ka reading se hi pta chalta hai inka koi grammar ka logic nahi hai.

Article Test 2.question: Kalidasa lived long before /Shakespeare so Shakespeare should /have been known as Kalidasa of England.
options: have been known as Kalidasa of England.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use the Kalidasa of England in place of Kalidas of  England
Kyunki yahan 'kalidasa' ko proper noun ki tarah nahi common noun ki tarah use kiya gya aur 'of England' phrase ki wajah se wo specific ho gya isliye 'the kalidasa' ka use hoga.

Article Test 2.question: The Prime Minister is holding the important meeting to review the security and safety of the doctors working in government hospitals.
Article Test 2.solution: use ‘an important ’ instead of ‘the important meeting’ kyunki yahan meeting ki baat first time ki gayi hai aur meaning bhi 'ek important meeting' nikal raha hai isliye 'the' nahi 'an' article ka use.

Article Test 2.question: He said /that he did not feel /any need to discuss /the episode in the detail.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use in detail in place of in the detail
kyunki 'in detail' ek fix phrase.
Note:- ese fix phrases ka reading se hi pata chalta hai inka koi grammar ka logic nahi hai.

Article Test 2.question: Does an English examination begin at 10 o’clock?
Article Test 2.solution: use ‘the English examination ’ instead of ‘an English examination ’ kyunki sentence ke meaning se pata chal raha hai ki puchhne wala kisi 'particular examination' ka 'time' puchh rha hai. Meaning se yeh baat clear hai ki 'speaker' aur 'listener' dono ko yeh pata hai ki kis exam ki baat ho rhi hai isliye 'the english examination' ka use hoga.

Article Test 2.question: He boasts of /having good knowledge /of mathematics but everybody /knows how far he is good at mathematics.
options: knows how far he is good at mathematics.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use a good knowledge in place of good knowledge
waise toh 'knowledge' uncountable noun hai but iske sath 'a good' phrase ka use allowed hai quantity ko refer karne ke liye, jaise 'a lot of/ a plenty of' etc. phrases ka use quantity ko dikhane ke liye hota hai yahan 'a good knowledge' ka meaning hai 'kaafi knowledge'

Article Test 2.question: To write a poem I need a pen, a diary and also the quiet place.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use ‘a quiet place’ instead of ‘the quiet place’
kyunki yahan is place ki baat first time hui hai aur meaning bhi nikal raha hai 'ek quiet place'.

Article Test 2.question: When the house was /set on the fire, all the people /started crying at the top /of their voices.
options: set on the fire, all the people
Article Test 2.solution:
Use set on fire in place of set on the fire
'Fire' noun ka use jab general aag wale meaning me karte hain toh yeh uncountable hota hai aur iske sath koi article nahi lagate.

Article Test 2.question: Due to a last minute snag, the mission on a moon had to be cancelled.
options: Due to a last minute snag
Article Test 2.solution:
Use ‘the’ instead of ‘a’
kyunki 'celestial body' se pehle 'the' article ka use kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 2.question: I don’t like /that type of a man /who does nothing but /find out faults with others.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use type of man in place of type of a man
'Kind/type/sort + of + noun' is structure me noun se pehle article ka use nahi karte.

Article Test 2.question: With this heat wave on, we are having a terrible weather.
Article Test 2.solution:
Remove ‘a’
kyunki 'weather' ek uncountable noun hai, aur uncountable noun ke pehle 'a/an' ka use nahi kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 2.question: In 2016 after some unseemly back-and-forth to the commons and Lords, it was decided that Act of Parliament should no longer be printed on calfskin.
options: should no longer be printed on calfskin
Article Test 2.solution:
Use ‘the’ before Lords
kyunki yahan 'commons' aur 'lords' do alag-alag category hain isliye 'lords' ke pehle article 'the' ka use kiya jayega.

Article Test 2.question: Tesla designed system for sending electricity over the air through a series of enormous towers.
options: through a series of enormous towers
Article Test 2.solution:
Use ‘a’ before system
kyunki 'singular countable noun' bina article ke use nahi kiya jaata.

Article Test 2.question: After knowing truth, the jury took the right decision in the case.
options: The jury took the right decision
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'knowing the truth' instead of 'knowing truth'
Truth (sachchai) ek hi hoti hai isliye use specific maan ke uske sath 'the' article ka use kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 2.question: Aniket lives in the small apartment in the suburbs.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'a small apartment' instead of 'the small apartment'
Kyunki yahan 'apartment' ki baat first time hui hai aur meaning bhi ek 'small apartment' aa rha hai.

Article Test 2.question: The present-century threats to our environment, which include interfering species, ailments, pollution and a boiling temperature, were putting wildlife populations at peril.
options: which include interfering species, ailments, pollution, and
The present-century threats to our environment
a boiling temperature, were putting wildlife populations at peril
Article Test 2.solution:
Remove 'a' before boiling temperature
Kyunki yahan temperature (tapman) uncountable noun ki tarah use hua hai.

Article Test 2.question: Sky appears blue as it absorbs all colours and reflects only blue.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the' article before sky
Kyunki sky, atmosphere, environment ye esi cheezen hain jo 'speaker' aur 'listener' done ke liye ek hi hoti hain isliye inse pehle 'the' article ka use kiya jaata hai.

Article Test 2.question: It was by a chance he saw a movie in a theatre.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'by chance' instead of 'by a chance'
Kyunki 'by chance' ek fixed phrase hai.

Article Test 2.question: You can fool some of the people all the time, and all the people some of the time; but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
options: You can fool some of the people all the time
but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
and all the people some of the time
Article Test 2.solution:
No error
Note :- yeh sentence kisi ko dhokadhadi ke kaam chhodne ke liye advice ke roop me bola gya hai.

Article Test 2.question: He will return in a hour.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'an hour' in place of 'a hour'
'hour' me 'h' silent hota hai isliye yeh vowel sound ka ho jaata hai.

Article Test 2.question: She was waiting for a opportunity to start her own business.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'an' in place of 'a'
Kyunki vowel sound ke pehle 'a' nahi 'an' lagta hai.

Article Test 2.question: This will be most difficult of the adjustments we have to make because we have been used to spending a lot on guests.
options: the adjustments we have to make
This will be most difficult of
because we have been used to
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the' before most
Superlative degree se pehle 'the' article ka use hota hai.

Article Test 2.question: Maruti likes adventure stories, especially an adventures of Tarzan.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the adventures of Tarzan' instead of 'an adventures of Tarzan'
Adventures noun plural hai iske sath 'an' article nahi aayega. Yeh ek title bhi hai jisme 'the' already hota hai.

Article Test 2.question: The historians are a great asset to the field of academia.
Article Test 2.solution:
Remove 'the' before historians
Yahan sab historians (plural noun) ki generalised sense me baat ho rahi hai isliye yahan koi article nahi aayega.

Article Test 2.question: Anti-party activities improved my relations with an opposition.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the opposition' in place of 'an opposition’
The ruling party - satta paksha, the opposition - vipaksha; yeh dono specific hote hain isliye inse pehle 'the' article ka use hota hai.

Article Test 2.question: She is in an hurry to meet her brother.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'in a hurry' instead of 'in an hurry'
Consonant sound ke sath 'an' nahi 'a' article ka use hota hai. 'In a hurry' ek fix phrase hai.

Article Test 2.question: I love to read certain stories from a Mahabharata.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the Mahabharata' in place of 'a Mahabharata'
Epics or holy books ke naam se pehle 'the' article lagta hai.

Article Test 2.question: The more he got to know her, more he got attracted towards her.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the more' instead of 'more'
Gradual increase/decrease wale structure me dono clause se pehle 'the comparative' ka use hota hai.

Article Test 2.question: The president rewarded that soldier for an exceptional bravery that he showed in the war.
options: that he showed in the war.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'the exceptional bravery' instead of 'an exceptional bravery’
Yahan bravery specific hai jo us soldier ne war me dikhayi thi.

Article Test 2.question: The student ought to respect his teachers and should be obedient.
Article Test 2.solution:
Use 'a student' instead of 'the student'
Kyunki yahan kisi specific student ki nahi balki ek general student ki baat ho rhi hai.

SVA Test 1.question: Rehan and Ronit are / good friends and / it don’t matter to them / as to who is wealthier.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘doesn’t’ instead of ‘don’t’ kyunki yahan subject 'it' hai jo ki singular aayegi 'doesn't'

SVA Test 1.question: Each and every man, /woman and child were given /food yesterday evening.
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use was in place of were
agar distributive adjective ka use kiya jaaye toh bhale hi nouns 'and' se join kiye gaye ho verb singular verb aati hai.

SVA Test 1.question: Neither the doctors nor / the nurse were present / when the patient / reached the hospital.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki agar do nouns neither…nor, either…..or, not only……but also, or, se connected ho tab verb, verb ke paas wale subject ke according aati hai, isliye yahan verb 'nurse' ke according singular aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: Five hours are too /short a time to/judge one’s character.
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use is in place of are
kyunki time, value, weight and length ko dikhane wale words jab ek unit ki tarah kaam karte hai toh unhe uncountable ki tarah treat kiya jaata hai.

SVA Test 1.question: Both Reeta and Ronika / has won / the dance competition / this year.
SVA Test 1.solution:
use ‘have’ instead of ‘has’ kyunki yahan 'Rita' aur 'Ronika' dono subject 'and' conjunction se joined hain isliye verb plural aayegi.
Note:- 'both' koi distributive adjective nahi hai.

SVA Test 1.question: The horse and /carriage have been standing at /the door for two hours.
SVA Test 1.solution: Use has in place of have. yahan is sentence me 'the horse and carriage' (ghoda baggi) ek unit ki tarah kaam kar raha hai isliye verb singular aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: They all, except Shirin, were very sad / during the farewell party given / to the teacher retiring, and her / indifference were well noticed.
options: They all, except Shirin, were very sad
to the teacher retiring, and he
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki yahan subject 'indifference' hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: More persons /than one has been /involved in this quarrel.
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use have in place of has.
More than one + noun(singular) + verb(singular)
More + noun(plural) + than one + verb(plural)

SVA Test 1.question: The boy, as well as / his friends, were / absent from the class / when the teacher came.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki as well as, except, in addition to, with, along with etc. yeh sab prepositional phrases hain isliye inke baad aane wala noun inka object ho jaata hai aur verb first wale noun ke according aati hai.

SVA Test 1.question: It is I who has /always helped you /in time of need.
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use have in place of has.
who relative pronoun ka apna koi number gender nahi hota ye jisko refer karta hai usi ke according verb leta hai yahan yeh 'I' pronoun ke liye aaya hai isliye verb 'I' according 'have' aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: Children listens to people / speaking around them / for a long time before / they begin to speak.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘listen’ instead of ‘listens’ kyunki 'child' ka plural children hota hai aur yahan subject 'children' hai toh iske according plural verb 'listen' aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: Many a profound thinker / believe that the march of civilization / has not coincided with real human progress.
options: believe that the march of civilization
has not coincided with real human progress.
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use believes in place of believe.
Many a + noun (singular) + verb (singular)
'many a' - distributive adjective ki tarah kaam karta hai.

SVA Test 1.question: The number of students / attending their classes / are constantly decreasing / in our university.
SVA Test 1.solution:
use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki –
The Number of + Noun (Plural) + Verb (Singular)
A Number of + Noun (Plural) + Verb (Plural)

SVA Test 1.question: In the struggle / between the bad and the good, the / bad is ultimately defeated.
options: between the bad and the good, the
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use are in place of is.
‘the bad’ =  bad people
the + adj = Common plural noun
eg. the rich = rich people

SVA Test 1.question: One of the major challenges / he faced during his / undergraduate days were / the shortage of money.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki yahan is verb ka subject 'one' hai isliye iske according singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: The staff of his collage is / opposed to the takeover because / they are convinced that they will lose their jobs.
options: The staff of his collage is
they are convinced that they will lose their jobs.
SVA Test 1.solution:
Use are in place of is.
‘staff’ noun ke sath sentence ke according singular and plural dono verb aa sakti hain, sentence me aage ‘they’ and ‘their’ jaise words se clear ho rha hai ki ‘staff’ word ko plural me use kiya jayega.

SVA Test 1.question: Every / curious child / want to / rip open a toy.
SVA Test 1.solution:
use ‘wants’ instead of ‘want’
every + noun(singular) + verb (singular)

SVA Test 1.question: No one were / present when I / entered the hall.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki 'no-one' subject ke sath verb singular aati hai.

SVA Test 1.question: The fisheries sector / have grown significantly / in the last one year.
SVA Test 1.solution:
use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki 'the fisheries sector' ek particular sector ka name hai aur iske liye verb singular aayegi.
Note:- fisheries sector hi sahi word hai na ki fishery sector, yeh yaad hi karna padega.

SVA Test 1.question: The crew / of sailors / were not perturbed / by the strong gale.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki yahan 'the crew' ek collective noun hai aur jab collective noun ek single unit ki tarah use kiye jaate hain toh verb singular aati hai.

SVA Test 1.question: The contrast between/Britain and other  countries/of Europe/are striking.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki yahan subject 'the contrast' hai jo ki singular hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: The river Yamuna has many non-native species like goldfish that is affecting its ecosystem.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘are’ instead of ‘is’ kyunki 'that' relative pronoun yahan 'non native species' ko refer karne ke liye rakha gya hai isliye 'that' ke baad plural aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: Great many students who are good at other subjects perform poorly in English.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘a great many’ instead of ‘great many' kyunki yahan mahaan students nahi bahut saare students wala meaning dena hai jo ki 'a good/great many + noun' se aata hai.

SVA Test 1.question: Each member / of the team / receive a memorabilia / after the match is over.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘receives’ instead of ‘receive’ kyunki 'member' noun se pehle 'each' distributive adjective laga hai isliye member subject ki verb singular aayegi which is 'receives'

SVA Test 1.question: The blue Lotus is one of the most beautiful flowers which grows in her garden.
options: is one of the most beautiful flowers
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘grow’ instead of ‘grows’ kyunki yahan 'which' ka antecedent 'flowers' plural noun hai uske according verb 'grow' aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: The perception / of success / vary / from person to person.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘varies’ instead of ‘vary’ kyunki yahan subject 'perception' hai jo ki singular  noun hai isliye verb singular aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: It have been only / through writing / that men have been able / to spread their ideas to mankind.
options: to spread their ideas to mankind
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki yahan 'it' singular noun hai isliye iske according singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 1.question: Billionaire Philip is the owner of the luxury yacht Lionheart, which worth an estimated $150 million.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘which is worth’ instead of ‘which worth’ kyunki 'worth' ek adjective hai yeh verb ka kaam nahi kar sakta isliye 'is' linking verb ka use karke structure sahi karna padega.

SVA Test 1.question: One of / the biggest enterprise / in India / is declaring a lockout.
SVA Test 1.solution:
use ‘enterprises’ instead of ‘enterprise’ kyunki 'of' preposition yahan selection ke liye aati hai isliye aage likha noun plural form me aata hai.
One of + Noun (Plural) + Verb (Singular)

SVA Test 1.question: Participating in the Republic Day Parade are consideredan honour by many people.
SVA Test 1.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki yahan subject banne ka kaam 'participating' gerund kar rha hai aur 'gerund' ya infinitive jab subject ka kaam karte hain toh verb singular aati hai.

SVA Test 2.question: Sterling is only twenty four but have achieved so much in his professional football career.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki 'sterling' kisi person ka name hai jo ki proper noun ho jayega aur singular verb lega.

SVA Test 2.question: The problem of world hunger arises because of the economic inequality that distort food distribution.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘distorts’ instead of ‘distort’ kyunki yahan that relative pronoun - the economic inequality ko refer kar rha hai jo ki singular noun hai isliye that ke sath singular verb aayegi

SVA Test 2.question: It is estimated that most of the addict, a whopping 85%, in God’s own country Kerala, are below 25 years of age.
SVA Test 2.solution:
use ‘most of the addicts’ instead of ‘most of the addict’ kyunki –Most of + Noun (Plural)
most of the addicts = jyadatar addicts

SVA Test 2.question: Our most memorable meeting with Spielberg happened while we were at the Berlin Film Festival in 1977, where the film ‘Shatranj ke Khilari ‘were being screened as India’s official entry.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki yahan subject 'shatranj ke khiladi' ek movie ka name hai jo ki proper noun hoga isliye singular singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: A recent government report highlight that the shortage of teachers in higher educational institutions is greater than that in countries like China, Brazil, Sweden and Russia.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘highlights’ instead of ‘highlight’ ki yahan subject 'a recent government report' hai jo ki singular noun hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Despite warnings the driver continued to speed and have been caught by the traffic police.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki yahan 'continued' aur 'have been caught' dono verb ka subject 'driver' hai jo ki singular noun isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: The news of his involvement in illegal activities have shocked everybody.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki 'news' ek uncountable noun maana jaata hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: He wanted to know the reason why his low score in Mathematics.
SVA Test 2.solution:
use ‘why his score was low’ instead of ‘why his score low’ kyunki sentence ke grammar and meaning ko correct karne ke liye yahan his score ko subject banna padega aur uske baad verb 'was' lagayi jayegi aur 'low' subject complement ban jayega.
Note :- Yahan ese bhi likh sakte hain:- he wanted to know the reason for his low score.
dono hi structure sahi hain.

SVA Test 2.question: Either Ramesh or Reema have the keys to the cupboard.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki agar do nouns neither…nor, either…..or, not only……but also, or, se connected ho tab verb apne paas wale noun ke according aati hai isliye yahan subject 'reema' ke according singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Over the years, the writer Amish has evolved to what millions of youngsters aspires to be today – an intellectual.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘aspire’ instead of ‘aspires’ kyunki yahan subject 'millions of youngsters' hai jo ki plural noun hai isliye iske according plural verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: When there were a strong wind, the pine trees made sad, eerie sounds.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki yahan 'there' introductory subject hai aur real subject 'a strong wind' hai jo ki ek singular noun ki tarah use kiya gya hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: A large amount of money he invested were wasted.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘was wasted’ instead of ‘were wasted’ kyunki yahan is verb ka subject 'A large amount of money' hai jisme 'a large amount of' ek quantity ko dikhane wala adjectival phrase hai aur 'money' subject hai jo ki ek uncountable noun hota hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Despite incessant rains, she is the only one who plan to attend the meeting at the ministry.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘plans’ instead of ‘plan’ and 'that' instead of 'who' kyunki yahan 'the only one' ko refer karna hai jiske liye relative pronoun that aayega aur 'that' ke baad singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Organizing World Cup matches in England imply that rains can be a constant threat.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘implies’ instead of ‘imply’ kyunki yahan subject ka kaam 'organizing' gerund kar rha hai 'world cup matches' gerund ka object hai. Gerund ya infinitive jab subject bante hain toh verb singular lagayi jaati hai.

SVA Test 2.question: We must plan how can we cope with the present situation.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘how we can cope with’ instead of ‘how can we cope with’ kyunki sentence ke meaning se pata chal rha hai ki yeh interrogative nahi hai yahan koi kisi se kuchh puchh nahi rha balki bta rha hai isliye verb interrogative nahi assertive structure me likhi jayegi yaani subject ke pehle nahi baad me likhi jayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Most of the work of this NGO are of little benefit to the disadvantages.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki all/most/some/plenty etc ke case me verb us noun ke according aati hai jisko ye refer krte hain yahan wo noun 'work' hai jo ki ek uncountable noun hai, isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: A Royal Bengal tigress and her three cubs was poison and their carcasses left to rot in the Wildlife Sanctuary in Goa.
options: and their carcasses left to rot
in the Wildlife Sanctuary in Goa
and her three cubs was poison
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘were poisoned’ instead of ‘was poison’ kyunki yahan subject 'A Royal Bengal tigress and her three cubs' plural hai isliye plural verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: We noticed that most of the shoppers in the mall looking for packets of ready to cook food.
options: packets of ready to cook food
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘in the mall were looking for’ instead of ‘in the mall looking for’ kyunki yahan shoppers subject hai aur iske liye verb ki zarurat hai 'looking' ke sath 'were helping' verb ka use karke sentence correct karna padega.

SVA Test 2.question: The neighbourhood were getting disturbed with the loud music that was playing at the wedding party in the big bungalow.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘was’ instead of ‘were’ kyunki yahan 'neighborhood' singular noun hai isliye iske according singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: According to environment activists, demolition of unauthorised apartment complexes are became a lesson for land encroachers.
SVA Test 2.solution: yahan subject 'demolition' hai jo ki singular noun hai isliye singular verb aayegi. Sentence ke meaning ke according yahan 'has become/became/is becoming' in verbs ka use kiya jaa sakta hai.

SVA Test 2.question: People with full time sedentary jobs who commuting long distances, may have sleep problems due to lack of exercise.
options: People with full time sedentary jobs
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘who commute’ instead of ‘who commuting’ kyunki yahan verb ke sath subject ‘who’ hai jo ki people ko refer kar rha hai. Commute verb ka correct form present indefinite me commute hi hoga.

SVA Test 2.question: Prasad recalled that meeting people have been a part of his life as a student activist.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘meeting people has been’ instead of ‘meeting people have been’ kyunki yahan subject gerund ‘meeting’ hai jo ki singular hota hai isliye singular verb has lagegi.

SVA Test 2.question: The simplest way to get proper recognition are through doing things with dedication and sincerity.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki yahan subject ‘The simplest way’ hai jo ki singular hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: The man with a lost eye have been accused for murder of two girls in his neighbourhood.
options: The man with a lost eye
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘has been accused of’ instead of ‘have been accused for’ kyunki subject singular hai aur accuse ke sath preposition ‘of’ ka use hota hai.

SVA Test 2.question: The Prime Minister, along with the other ministers have left for America.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘has’ instead of ‘have’ kyunki jab singular noun ke sath ‘along with’ use hota hai toh verb us singular noun ke according hi lagti hai.

SVA Test 2.question: Everything that I like to eat are fattening.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki ‘Everything’ singular subject hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Only one copy of the book, running into 1200 pages, on Gandhiji's visit to the State of Andhra Pradesh, remain now.
options: on Gandhiji's visit to the State
Only one copy of the book
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘remains’ instead of ‘remain’ kyunki subject ‘Only one copy’ singular hai isliye singular verb aayegi.

SVA Test 2.question: Those who follow a healthy routine is likely enjoying good health.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘are likely to enjoy’ instead of ‘is likely enjoying’ kyunki subject plural hai aur correct grammatical structure ‘are likely to + verb’ hoti hai.

SVA Test 2.question: The famous author and actor are being honoured at a function today.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘is’ instead of ‘are’ kyunki ‘author and actor’ ek hi person ke liye use hua hai isliye subject singular maana jaayega.

SVA Test 2.question: The birth of a girl bring great joy to Neha’s family.
SVA Test 2.solution: use ‘brings’ instead of ‘bring’ kyunki subject singular hai isliye singular verb aayegi.
